author: Latha Koumar
content: Digital Transformation -  Buy or Build   Modern, cloud-based digital technology is necessary for financial institutions that are seeking to address the customer experience, improve internal operational effectiveness, streamline internal communications and allow access to data across the enterprise. For years, the only option was to develop such technology in-house, at great expense and expenditure of resources.   But today, banks and credit unions have a better option: the ability to buy technology and implement it quickly, cost effectively and more efficiently than they could on their own.  Partnering with fintechs can help banks meet their operational objectives, enhance products and improve customer experience. To maximize the chances of success in these partnerships, banks should pursue certain best practices. They need to:   Treat partnerships as a strategic priority, with proper C-suite attention devoted to them Select the right partnership mechanism Create a culture and capabilities that will attract fintech partners  Organize themselves in the right way to accelerate speed to market Ensure alignment in areas where disputes can arise  Micro-transformations represent an opportunity for Fis to get some « Quick Wins » under the belt , by implementing smaller bite-size technology projects that can have a narrow but measurable impact on the institution .   Micro-transformation allow institutions to accelerate time to value , by tackling the higest ROI, least disruptive changes first, then layering an additional features over time. They steadily move the enterprise toward full -fledged digital transformation , in manageable, cost-effective chuncks.  Return on Investment (or ROI) is one of the most important factors for these decisions and we see people struggle with it all the time.  ROI is a tool. It can be used properly or it can be used incorrectly. It’s not a solution for every problem. There’s an old saying: “If your only tool is a hammer then every problem looks like a nail.” – If your only tool is ROI then every project looks like a financial investment.  Key Points  • A well-structured ROI analysis can help improve IT and business alignment. • ROI analysis and prioritization can be done quickly (with estimated data) to identify top-tier projects or it can be done more thoroughly (with detailed data) to develop comprehensive implementation plans. • Comparing past project outcomes to project expectations helps with future ROI projections. • The ultimate measure of all initiatives is business value. Don’t get blindsided by other variables such as technology novelty or  competitive reactions. • Neither technology nor process change alone can solve a problem or achieve an objective. Utilize both to be successful

author: Frédéric Grillot
content: Discover our last invited paper in MDPI Applied Science. To go a step further, this paper discusses the application of multimode laser physics to semiconductor mode-locked lasers. We reviewed experimental and modeling results that help distinguish the different multimode contributions, trace the physical sources  and show device examples where the contributions may differ in strengths.  With this paper, scientists, researchers and engineers can obtain a good sense of the utilizations of semiconductor QD technology for mode-locking applications.

author: Latha Koumar
content: Why is digitised cash better than stablecoins - Stablecoins towards a trusted digital currency  Since the birth of the first cryptocurrency, Bitcoin, many have sought to unlock the promise of the underlying technology innovation to streamline national currency transactions. With global payments annual revenues estimated at $1.9 trillion according to a 2018 McKinsey report, the potential prize for those who can do so is massive.  Stablecoins take advantage of the same type of peer-to-peer blockchain technology that powers bitcoin, but enhanced. All transactions are secured, tracked and recorded on a distributed ledger system. However, the value of stablecoins is pegged to real-world assets such as fiat currency, gold and other commodities, so they avoid the volatility and price swings that have blighted bitcoin and the first generation of crypto-assets.  Crypto Assets   •Open market cryptocurrency  •Value based on demand •e.g. Bitcoin   Bitcoin challenges    Speed, Efficiency & Anonymity    •Bitcoin transactions can take 10-60 minutes to complete  •As the usage increases, the complexity of the mining calculations grows •Anti-terror and anti-money laundering is very challenging  Stablecoins  •Pegged cryptocurrency •Value of each “coin” is fixed to an external standard, usually a strong currency or commodity such as gold   Advantages   •Relative predictability •Security - Stablecoins are managed using blockchain to track ownership  •Transparency •Microtransactions - Fewer parties make it efficient to handle very low value transactions (e.g. web news content or emerging economy payments) •Innovation – Crypto can be programmed to enable entirely new business models •Auditable - This combination of replicated data and a complete audit trail make it a very secure environment for the exchange of title   Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC)  •Issued by a central bank & pegged to the price of the local currency e.g. The Digital Euro  𝐃𝐈𝐒𝐓𝐑𝐈𝐁𝐔𝐓𝐄𝐃 𝐃𝐈𝐆𝐈𝐓𝐀𝐋 𝐂𝐀𝐒𝐇:  - Regulated  - AML Compliant  - Permissioned  - No more liquidity needed   𝐒𝐓𝐀𝐁𝐋𝐄𝐂𝐎𝐈𝐍:  - Tradeable  - Flexible  - Need of liquidity (from 3rd parties)  - Programable money   Which solution will prevail? Three factors may shape the future:  Ability to manage personal information :Transaction details can be classified as personal data in some jurisdictions, and subject to data protection laws.   Interoperability with existing infrastructure : The advantage of a digital cash solution is that banks are already interconnected to both physical-to-digital (e.g., deposit at an ATM) and digital-to-physical cash networks.  Regulatory challenges : In addition to regulations regarding personal data, payment and banking regulations also govern who can hold accounts and how they use them.

author: Jacek Dudkiewicz
content: It is beyond a debate if AI will have an impact on the Society.  As AI continues to seep further into our day to day lives it creates more ripples in the society. AI is evolving everyday enabling humans to build comfortable, productive, efficient and easy lifestyles.  Of course the transition that we are making in incorporating AI into our lives on both personal and professional fronts is not all roses and blue skies. Any stimulus introduced into the society is going to create a buzz both good and bad.  While there is a LOT that needs to be done to make AI reliable technology, it has already redefined the way industries work by leaps and bounds. AI is making distances shorter, opening avenues for learners and supporting businesses to work and grow even in unreliable times of pandemics, wars and natural calamities.  One of the ways in which AI is empowering businesses to grow and entrepreneurs to flourish is providing different platforms, softwares and tools to be able to recruit, manage and train teams remotely. In the past, any man-made or natural calamity would prove disastrous for the economy but AI has helped to mitigate the adverse effects to a large extent over the last two years which have been trying times across the globe.   As AI continues to evolve, it will continue to bring about ease to conduct business and will also help coming generations of entrepreneurs to start bootstrap ventures which will only lead to a boost in economy.  Do drop in a line with your insights, I would to know what is you take on how AI has empowered businesses and entrepreneurs.   . . . .  You can follow me here Jacek Dudkiewicz . Just click on the bell icon on the profile to stay tuned- I'll give you a glimpse of what's possible with RPA like never before.  #automation #machinelearning #robotics #artificialintelligence #entrepreneurs

author: JOLIMOI
content: JOLIMOI est fier de vous annoncer sa levée de fonds de 7M€ auprès de Seventure Partners, investisseur de long terme qui accompagne activement en capital les entreprises innovantes ayant un impact positif sur l’Homme, la société et la planète.  Nous sommes également fiers d’accueillir de nouveaux Business Angels Thierry Petit (Impact Investor, Made-for-all.com, ex co-CEO de ShowroomPrivé) , Nathalie Balla (Co-repreneur de La Redoute), Roland Tripard (Président IAD) et @Paul Le (founder et CEO La Belle Vie) aux côtés de nos fidèles Business Angels Pauline Duval (DG Groupe Duval), Sébastien Lucas (ex CEO Oxalyde), Marc Menase (Founders Future), Pierre Besnaïnou (Sweet’in, Liberty Surf), pour devenir le leader du social selling responsable.  JOLIMOI digitalise et professionnalise le métier de la vente par réseau et par recommandation en créant la 1ère #plateforme de #social #selling multimarques dans la #beauté.  Aujourd’hui, Jolimoi c’est :  5000 Stylistes Beauté indépendants et passionnés en France et en Belgique ;  60 marques-partenaires impliquées ;  40 collaborateurs qui composent la Team Jolimoi.  Ces 7M€ vont nous servir à :  développer notre technologie propriétaire à destination de nos Stylistes Beauté ;  élargir notre offre produits et le nombre de marques-partenaires ;  recruter des centaines de milliers d’indépendants ;  et doubler la taille de notre équipe.  #leveedefonds #fundraising #beautytech #socialselling #tech #startup  ----- JOLIMOI is proud to announce its fundraising of €7M with Seventure Partners, a long-term investor who provides capital support to innovative companies that have a positive impact on people, society and the planet.  We are also proud to welcome new Business Angels @Thierry Petit (ex-CEO Showroom), @Nathalie Balla, @RolandTripard (IAD President) & @PaulLe (La Belle Vie founder and CEO) alongside our loyal Business Angels ( @Pauline Duval (DG Groupe Duval), Sébastien Lucas (ex CEO Oxalyde), Marc Menase (Founders Future), Pierre Besnaïnou (Sweet'in, Liberty Surf), to become the leader in responsible social selling.JOLIMOI is digitizing and professionalizing the business of selling by network and by recommendation by providing the 1st #platform for multi-brand social selling in #beauty.  Today, Jolimoi is:  5000 independent and passionate Beauty Stylists in France and Belgium;  60 brand-partners involved;  40 employees who make up Team Jolimoi. author: Robin Horsfall
content: Walking the tightrope of war.  In a democracy it is essential for decisions to be agreed by Parliament and the people. Although it appears slow and frustrating to those involved in active war this legal process must be concluded in order to bring a nation's wealth behind a campaign. Public opinion is a vital part of the democratic process.   Western leaders understand the fear and pain of Ukraine. They have the same fears. They don't want missiles hitting their own countries.  They want to do all they can to assist Ukraine (and themselves) for the long term future.  Our leaders are walking a tight rope of fear. If they fall to the left and do nothing they put off the day of reckoning for a while and hope the tyrant will stop and say 'that's enough'.   If they fall to the right and mount aggressive war they confront the possibility of escalating to an extreme level.  Somewhere in between is a balance between nothing and too much.   What that balance is depends on how close a nation is to the conflict and what they have to give up in order to fight.   Money, supplies, technology and weapons are already on the way but what about no fly zones or soldiers? Our leaders say 'Not yet, - not unless Putin extends his war outside of Ukraine.'  Intelligence is a weapon that can be supplied without risk. Where and what are the Russians weapons, what are their intentions? This intelligence allows the Ukrainians to use their arms efficiently.   It appears that the loose alliances of the west, the EU, NATO and the Australasians have agreed to try to contain the violence in Ukraine, - if possible, while doing all they can to help Ukraine win the battles.   The west is beating its drums on the borders with Ukraine and Russia to contain the conflict and to keep vital Russian defences fixed elsewhere. Air defences are patrolling no mans land in the sky, sending a message 'Don't come here. We will kill you!'. Putin is not as crazy as he would like us to think, he is staying on his own side of the fence.  Some are shouting for a total oil embargo to bankrupt Russia. Our leaders must consider whether this is more damaging to us than it is to Russia, (another tightrope). Such a decision could result in our own financial collapse. Without energy for industry our people would have to sacrifice their employment. In a democracy that would not work for long and support for Ukraine would wither. There is always a  fine balance for leaders to maintain.  Today they support Ukraine in Ukraine. They will do all they can to defeat Putin on the conventional battlefield. Dictators can't resign. If Putin fails he dies, his own people will finish him. He must not win!  Slava Ukraine!  Who Dares Shares!  Robin Horsfall

content: It’s been 25 years ago since I dropped out of grad school where I was doing International Politics, to join one of the most prestigious companies in the world… in the best city in the world - NYC! AT&T took a chance on me and on a Friday the 13th (my lucky day!) I signed my employment contract and it was my dream come true.   The rest is history.   It has been an exhilarating ride - I wouldn’t trade it for anything in the world. I was obsessed with technology at a time when it wasn’t “cool” and a time when there definitely were not many women in the sector. I have had the chance to meet and work with some of the most amazing people, well mostly (!) and make some lifelong friends. I have learned from the best whether it be about technology, leadership or management.  These 25 years have flown by - mostly because I love what I do and the people I do it with. I am indebted to all the people who coached, mentored and guided me over the years and impacted my life and my career and have made me who and what I am today! Thank you! author: Shirish Deodhar
content: Pleased to announce the acquisition of GullyBuy’s technology and IP by Hesa Technologies (https://hesa.co/). Hyderabad based Hesa offers India’s largest tech integrated marketplace for rural India, backed by a sizeable ground workforce called the ‘Hesaathis’. Their B2B platform currently spans 50,000 villages and 6 million consumers, served by 32,000 micro entrepreneurs. They have 65+ brand partnerships and recently launched their own consumer brand (Suhas).   GullyBuy was founded with the objective of empowering local stores, numbering 12+ million in India, that are getting marginalized by the e-commerce giants. Our MarketTech platform, based on a mobile first strategy, is built to achieve high scalability with minimal cloud resources. The USPs are merchant empowerment and a digital marketplace. Unlike the competition, GullyBuy merchants get a mobile app to directly interface with customers and control every aspect of their business. Instead of an online app or link for each individual store, the GullyBuy consumer app offers an aggregate market view of local stores in their area of interest. They can compare and buy products from any store, while merchants get to promote themselves to a much larger consolidated base of users.   This deal is exciting since it will extend the benefits of our technology to a large and fast-growing base of retail entrepreneurs and consumers, albeit adapted by Hesa to their requirements and brand. We love the change they are bringing to rural areas which have been grossly underserved by digital transformation.   Congratulations to the GullyBuy team for their contributions in building an innovative solution! We are also very grateful to everyone who supported and encouraged us (our merchants, users, partners, investors, and well-wishers).   What next after GullyBuy? Not sure yet. Would love to do a non-profit social venture as a final effort. But only after a long break and provided we can come up with a good idea!   Vamsi Udayagiri, Swati Deodhar, Dr. Prasad Chitale,(PH.D.), Abhay Phadke, Amol Potnis, Hemant Joshi, Madhukar Bhatia, Siddharth Sethi   https://lnkd.in/ggpJT-mz

author: Glenn Mansfield
content: Paying with contactless took a bit of getting used to.  But, I’m not sure you’ll get your head around this latest technology…  37-year-old, Patrick Paumen, only has to place his hand against the card reader to make a payment.   This is because he has a microchip injected under his skin.  A microchip was first implanted into a human back in 1998, but it is only during the past decade that the technology has been available commercially.  When it comes to implantable payment chips, British-Polish firm, Walletmor, says that last year it became the first company to offer them for sale.  Walletmor's chip, which weighs less than a gram and is a little bigger than a grain of rice, is comprised of a tiny microchip and an antenna encased in a biopolymer - a naturally sourced material, similar to plastic.  If you’re wondering whether the procedure hurts, Mr Paumen said it “hurts as much as when someone pinches your skin”.  Would you do this? Or are you going to stick to Apple Pay?   https://lnkd.in/ezbkqTzF #AI #Technology #Business

author: Matt Phillips
content: What makes a good case study?  Case studies are, of course, a powerful tool in the marketing tool kit, as they create real-world examples of how a business can solve its customers’ problems.   They also carry an implicit endorsement of your brand - that deferred trust is incredibly valuable.   And from a PR perspective, they can unlock PR opportunities in new areas where you might not otherwise be able to earn coverage.   A few years ago we were struggling to gain traction for a particular client, but a great case that formed the backbone of that client’s PR for almost a year and still features on the first page of a google search for their brand.  Question is, where to start? In practice it can be hard to get them done.   So I’d start with a client audit, using the criteria below:   Topical: anything ‘of the moment’ gives you an angle to talk about hot topics in the news - these are more likely to interest journalists.     Measurable: anything with numbers, demonstrating the before/ after effect. Ideally offers a specific example of what makes your company different.    Impactful: anything involving a bigger brand and/ or well-known people. These brands/ people will always have more media interest (and reach) than smaller ones.     Visual: anything that can give a journalist an excuse to carry an interesting image. No picture, no story!     Unusual: anything in the case studies that is new/ different/ weird a first OR confirms/ rebuts a stereotype.    People: particularly with larger brands, getting numbers (and press office approval) for a written case study can be hard. But if you have a client/ customer eager for publicity they may be able to force it through (or help you develop a creative way of surfacing the work) without getting a written case study through official channels.    Tension: anything that might create a bit of friction or tension, telling a story of change. Something that suggests an old way is dying, that something new is not working, or shows how one company/ person is beating another.  What’s your experience of creating case studies?   Which of the above things do you think is most important?  What are your biggest challenges in creating case studies?  ///////  PPR is a pay-as-you-go PR service for scaleups.  Our method is designed for mission-led technology businesses who have enough traction to be taken seriously, but are not yet famous. Our transparent PAYG model is designed to be flexible, breaking the norm of sunk-cost day rates and retainers. And we use blended staff/ freelance teams to get the job done.  I post regularly about #publicrelations and how it can help business leaders to connect and grow. Please ask me a question, connect - and click on the bell icon on my profile to receive a notification whenever I post.  Or if you’d like to book a one-on-one chat to find out more about our services, @tag me in the comments below and I’ll get in touch.  #startups #marketing

author: Nischal Shetty
content: Web3 is not an overuse of innovation where adoption will not create any real value for consumers. In fact, its adoption is needed to give control back to end users.   To make decisions for yourself, you don't need to rely on big corporations to provide you with the resources to make the decisions.   The idea of Web3 did not emerge because there was lack of innovation on the internet. It did so because technology needs to benefit consumers and give them a right to democratic decision making.   You can follow the opinion of the critics or Do Your Own Research.

author: Orel Hershkovitch
content: It has been 9 years since I joined ISLINE, a leading Israeli freight forwarder my father founded in the 80s.  I was attracted by the opportunity to enter an industry that is so crucial to all of us but at the same time so shockingly outdated, complex, and inefficient. That day I made it my mission to advance our business with innovative technologies while keeping our customers at the center of it all.  Today, I am extremely happy with where ISLINE is and excited about a new major milestone: The world's leading technology platform for global logistics, FLEXPORT, has chosen ISLINE as their partner in Israel.  When I first read the vision of FLEXPORT, I realized that they define (and execute) in a simply amazing way what once motivated me to join this industry.  Within only 8 years, they have managed to improve the daily business of tens of thousands of supply chain companies. They continue to grow by hundreds of percent year after year with maximum focus on their overarching goal - to take this industry into a digital, transparent, efficient era for all supply chain links and first and foremost for their customers.  The ISLINE Israel team and I are proud and enjoy working with the amazing team at FLEXPORT. Professionals who have found the balance between experience and technological advancement.  Yalla, back to work, to continue improving the lives of thousands of Israeli importers and exporters.  #freight #business #digitization Fevzi Torcu, MBA Vasco Medina Flexport

author: Dries Budding
content: Last Tuesday was a very happy and proud moment: as a culmination of more than 15 years of hard work, we were finally able to open our Molecular Culture Concept Lab, where we can perform all bacterial diagnostics with unprecedented speed and accuracy. The world’s fastest bacteriology lab now stands in Amsterdam, but the underlying Molecular Culture technology will soon be able to be used by labs around the world.  The formal opening the lab was performed by my once PhD supervisor, longtime collaborator, and now chairman of our scientific advisory board: prof. Paul Savelkoul. The journey to this moment has seen so many ups and downs, so many moments of great despair followed by new hope. Seeing all our hopes now become a reality was truly a memorable moment for both of us!  Paul has been there for the whole journey, but many others have also been there almost from the beginning, or have done great work at later stages. So a very big thanks to the whole inbiome team for working so hard for so many years to make this happen!  P.H.M. Savelkoul, prof. dr., inbiome, #diagnostics, #moleculardiagnostics, #molecularculture, #laboratory

author: Shaun Simons
content: The Bedford Estates has appointed Compton to work alongside Edward Charles & Partners to help support their ambitious plans for its 30 acre Bloomsbury Estate in the heart of central London.  As commercial leasing agents, we will assist in the elevation of Bloomsbury’s status as a core part of London’s new Knowledge Quarter. Our work will also support The Bedford Estates’ focus on long-term sustainability, preserving the historic fabric of the properties while applying modern, innovative building techniques.  The Bedford Estates has owned, developed and managed much of Bloomsbury since 1669. The Estate includes c.200 properties, including 825,000 sq ft of offices, 100,000 sq ft retail space, 1,000 hotel bedrooms and 550 residential homes as well as five Garden Squares.  “Bloomsbury is the most central part of London where culture, academia, science and technology meet. With Georgian architecture, green open spaces, and garden squares all carefully maintained for generations by the family-owned Bedford Estates, we are looking forward to working with Compton to help us promote the area as a place where, whether you live, work or study here, you can feel at home.” Simon Elmer, Steward of The Bedford Estates.

author: IBS Software
content: NEWS | Flybe's return to the skies powered by IBS Software's iFly Res PSS platform. IBS Software’s next-gen solution, iFly Res, will support Flybe, Britain's new regional airline, with a customer-centric passenger service system (PSS), providing state of the art offer and order management capabilities, fully supporting IATA’s NDC and ONE Order standard. This includes an airline portal, a modern booking engine for consumers and a unique agency portal to drive indirect sales through a cost-effective channel with merchandising upsell opportunities.   “We are excited to be working with IBS Software to realise our goal of launching our new airline, growing and delivering a customer-focused system that merges retail capability with modern technology solutions,” said Dave Pflieger, CEO of Flybe. “The flexibility of this reservations system, along with an excellent partnership, made iFly Res the perfect choice for us. We’re looking forward to continuing to leverage technology and innovation with IBS Software by our side.”   “This partnership will help Flybe to provide its customers with a data-driven, personalised digital experience that will make travelling around its network easier than ever before. We have been keen to welcome Flybe as a customer, and we are pleased to stand side-by-side with them as we begin an exciting journey together,” said David Friderici, Senior VP and Head of Aviation Passenger Solutions at IBS Software.   Pictured: Dave Pflieger (L), Flybe CEO with Anand Krishnan (R), IBS Software CEO   #Flybe #LetsFlybe #iFlyRes #AviationNews #AviationIndustry #PassengerServiceSystem #AviationTech #IBSSoftware

author: Zara Zamani
content: 99% of European economy is built by Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) This makes adoption of technology in SMEs extremely critical to EU. Yet, Scientific literature rather focuses on big organizations while studying technology adoption.  But that is not all, the technology and its nature has evolved enormously over the past decades, yet the latest revision of technology adoption theories and frameworks come from 90s.   What does all of these mean for SMEs and what do they actually look into while adopting a new technology?  This is actually what I answered in my latest published article in European Journal of Innovation Management. author: ProTech Recruitment Ltd - Science, Technology, Engineering and Manufacturing Recruiter
content: ProTech Recruitment Ltd have today announced their transition to employee ownership with effect from 11 April 2022.  The shareholders have transferred 100% of their shares to an employee ownership trust (EOT) for the benefit of its 14 employees.  ProTech, which was founded in 1988 and specialises in the scientific, technology, engineering and manufacturing sectors, was 60% owned by Managing Director Antony Cox - who bought the company in 2003 as part of a merger - and 40% by Director Roman Motyczak.  Antony and Roman had started to think about succession planning a few years earlier, "mindful of the fact we're not getting any younger".  Before the pandemic struck, ProTech had been growing "fairly steadily" at an average rate of 20-25% a year, but Antony admits Covid "set us back five years and got us thinking about other ways of exiting the business".  He says a referral from a member of the Employee Ownership Association (EOA) opened their eyes to the ownership model and set the ball rolling.  Antony said: "We found out that neighbours in our building, Blizzard Group, had transitioned themselves into an EOT in 2020 and I was talking to them and thought 'actually, that's worth investigating'.  "That got me thinking, 'if they've done it, could we do it?' That's how it all started, in terms of the idea of it as a possible exit route, and from there two directors of Blizzard gave us the inside track, which was really useful.  "It was a good choice for us, probably being too small for anyone to be interested in buying us as a commercial sale. Furthermore it gives our people complete control over their future, which is the opposite of what a commercial sale would bring."  ProTech, which provides skilled people on both a temporary and permanent contract, appointed EOA supporter members Baxendale Employee Ownership to steer it through its employee ownership journey.  Director Roman says Baxendale made the whole process "low impact and straightforward", revealing its advisers visited the whole ProTech team around a month before transitioning to make the internal announcement.  "It helped having a third party come in and make that announcement, to talk about it conceptually and then we were able to follow up and field questions," said Roman.  "It gives those people that have worked with you, particularly over the two years of Covid, a chance to own the business and benefit from it.  "In our minds, it was that duty of care by them benefitting after we have sold the business, whereas if we'd sold to a third party they could have had their own plans and before you know it the business has disappeared and all the staff have gone and we would have felt quite guilty."  To read the rest of our announcement please click the link in the comments.  #EmployeeOwned #EOT #EmployeeOwnership

author: Dr Agata Slater
content: Something nice happened over the weekend. I received a bottle of wine from friends who were visiting me. While that’s pretty nice in itself, what cheered me up even more was that the bottle was #blockchain #certified.   My friends do not know much about what I exactly do for a living so the choice they made in the store was not about pleasing me. When I asked about what made them buy this particular type of wine, they mentioned that (apart from the general wine preferences), they liked that there was some sort of quality #certificate on it, and that they could interact with the product via the #qrcode (without knowing at all what “blockchain” meant).   After scanning the QR code, the consumer sees but a full account of the wine’s DNA: when and where the grapes were harvested, how the wine was treated – for example the quality of the sulphites – the bottling date, lot number and more. This information is based on #data captured during each stage of the wine making process, and recorded into a blockchain.   This is a wonderful, real-life example of a consumer choice being influenced by product #quality. This is very much in line with CarrefourSA observations that #blockchain tracking can boost #sales of some products:   https://lnkd.in/dYuVMcXM   For me, it also also very rewarding to see the impact of blockchain technology right in front of me. This is a real story btw!   And kudos to #CasaGirelli wine makers for caring about their consumers and helping them make informed decisions about purchases.  #blockchain #provenance #trackingsolutions #traceability #sustainabilty #consumercentric

author: Vitor Hugo - Coordenação e Gestão de Projectos S.A.
content: PROJECT VHM // Escola Superior de Tecnologia e Gestão  O projeto consiste num novo edifício de investigação da ESTG, que faz por sua vez a articulação entre outros equipamentos existentes na propriedade. Do ponto de vista da conceção arquitetónica, o desenvolvimento do projeto centra-se em várias premissas principais, que muito envolvem a integração do edifício no tecido urbano, a sua articulação com a topografia e a vivência do utilizador. A volumetria é a imagem de marca do edifício. Este apresenta-se como um monolítico esculpido, inspirado na “máquina”, assumindo-se por uma forma irreverente, espontânea e veloz, conferida pelos seus ângulos retos e formas distorcidas, pretendendo assumir-se como um objeto de destaque da cidade, um marco dinamizador. Neste sentido, o edifício insere-se no centro do seu terreno, liberto das construções envolventes, de forma a ser também observado, de mostrar a sua forma e volumetria, desenvolvendo-se voltado para a paisagem ao redor, com a inserção de vários pontos de interesse e de permanência.  Technology and Management School  The project consists of a new research building for the ESTG, which in turn provides the connection between other existing facilities on the property. The architectural conception approach is centred on several main premises, which greatly involve the integration of the building into the urban context, its articulation with the topography and the user’s experience. Volumetry is the building’s brand image. It stands as a sculpted monolith, inspired by the “machine”, adopting an irreverent, spontaneous and swift shape, conferred by its right angles and distorted outlines, with the purpose to be a prominent object of the city, a dynamic landmark. As such, the building is located in the centre of its site, free from the surrounding constructions, so that it can also be observed, show its shape and volumetry, and evolve towards the surrounding landscape, with the insertion of several points of interest and permanence. #vhm #project #building #technology

author: Antoine GREGO
content: Comment combattre efficacement le paludisme ?  Cette semaine dans la newsletter :  𝐋𝐞 𝐩𝐨𝐝𝐜𝐚𝐬𝐭 Demain & Durable     Dans l’épisode du jour, je souhaitais vous repartager le parcours et les ambitions de Franck Langevin. Après avoir travaillé dans le monde de la tech, Franck a décidé d’évoluer drastiquement et de s’envoler au Burkina Faso pour rejoindre Gerard et fondé MAÏA Africa.  Leur objectif : réduire la mortalité due au paludisme grâce à leur pommade. Un échange qui m’a fortement marqué il y a plus d'un an, et qui j’espère vous inspirera également.  Mais également :   𝐋’𝐚𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐝𝐞 𝐥𝐚 𝐬𝐞𝐦𝐚𝐢𝐧𝐞 : Prendre soin de sa TV  Une TV émet en moyenne 200 kg de CO2 lors de la fabrication, et 156 lors de son utilisation ! Il est nécéssaire de comprendre l'impact de la TV et comment limiter son impact avec quelques conseils et notamment le partage d'une étude HOP // Halte à l'Obsolescence Programmée sur le sujet que je vous recommande !   𝐋𝐞 𝐜𝐡𝐢𝐟𝐟𝐫𝐞 :1er Janvier 2023  La bonne nouvelle de la semaine, c’est le décret sorti le 14 Avril dernier sur le greenwashing qui oblige les entreprises à publier leurs démarches d'atteinte à la neutralité carbone. Malheureusement pas suffisant car le champ d'application reste trop grand. Pour aller plus loin je vous recommande de taguer Alerte Greenwashing ou Pour un réveil écologique si vous voyez une pub faisant preuve de #greenwashing   𝐋𝐞 𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐧𝐮 : Les métaux rares    Depuis que je dois rechercher chaque semaine un contenu à vous partager, je me rends compte qu’Arte est l’une des seules chaînes avec autant de contenus sur l’environnement (je suis donc devenu fan d'ARTE). Dans un format 5 minutes, les formats “Data Science” permettent de mieux comprendre différents sujets. Aujourd’hui, je vous propose de parler donc des métaux rares !   A mardi prochain !  #newsletter  #impactpositif #ecologie #paludisme

author: Pascal Marrant
content: L’amour est doux comme une onde divine, un mot parmi tant d’autres, et parfois, il apparait surgissant de nulle part et votre être tout entier est foudroyé en un instant. L’amour submerge pour papillonner en pampilles soyeuses, un feu d’artifice où j’ai simplement ajouté un des bijoux Baümer pour le faire glisser vers l’authenticité, la sincérité, et la fidélité. Je vous parle de celle de mes rêves les plus enfouis, de cette femme au bord du paradis de mon cœur qui m’ensorcelle le jour et qui la nuit comme la déesse minerve illumine mes nuits des feux de l’enfer. Doux bijoux que tu portes sur toi, qui avec tes yeux bleus, comme le ciel, réchauffent ma vie de caresses enrobées de douceur. En recevant ce présent, je marche sur la voie lactée qui baigne dans ton âme et brille à jamais à travers les cieux. Je me demande, chaque jour, chaque nuit, comment font ceux qui n’ont jamais eu prés d’eux, ni ton sourire ni ton regard. Si la haine est la nécropole de l’âme, l‘amour est l’expression du cœur, et pour une juste compensation, une boucle d’oreille du battement de mon cœur Baümer vient sceller celui-ci à jamais. F https://lnkd.in/dKkjChku

author: Anne idride de Saudium
content: A MICHEL QUI AIMAIT TANT MES TEXTES  Tu étais le plus reconnaissable de nos acteurs Français, et c’est moi qui vais te rendre aimable, toi l’homme de « La femme infidèle » si froid et si machiavélique. Tu planais en apesanteur les yeux brillants, pleins de candeur, et de subtilité, bouche en croissant au beurre pour jouer « Le Colonel Chabert ». Ce soir, je broie du noir car je viens de perdre ton au revoir, et j’ai les mains moites, les mêmes, que ce chef d’entreprise haïssait, si bien modelé dans « Le Jouet ». Voici mes cortèges de larmes qui tombent, et je suis pétrifié par cette nouvelle. La gorge serrée et le cœur battant, je voudrais une dernière fois voir ton sourire, même si celui-ci doit me coûter ma fortune, car il enrichira ceux qui le recevront, sans appauvrir celui qui le donne. Ton souvenir restera éternel, et personne n’est assez riche pour s’en passer ni assez pauvre pour ne pas le mériter. Tu créais le bonheur dans les foyers et tu étais le signe sensible de l’amitié de « Tous les matins du monde ». Nul n’a autant besoin d’un sourire même sarcastique que celui qui perd un ami. Alors, salut l’artiste, adieu à ce tigre recréé par la magie de ton interprétation où Michel tu te glissais avec génie dans la peau de « Clémenceau » pour au final nous donner un bouquet d’émotion. Voici le sentiment de la vie réelle qui t’abandonne aujourd’hui peu à peu, sous les ondes insondables de cette mer où les rêveurs des théâtres, ont laissé leur raison, sous les applaudissements. F  https://lnkd.in/ewYGKfMY

author: Naully Nicolas
content: La #souveraineténumérique désigne la capacité de contrôler sa propre destinée numérique, c'est-à-dire les données, le matériel et les logiciels dont on dépend et qu'on crée. Elle est devenue une préoccupation pour de nombreux décideurs politiques qui estiment que trop de contrôle est cédé à trop peu d'endroits, que le choix est trop limité sur le marché des technologies et que trop de pouvoir est entre les mains d'un petit nombre de grandes entreprises technologiques.  L'une des principales préoccupations concernant la souveraineté numérique est qu'un petit nombre de grandes entreprises technologiques contrôlent des quantités massives de données sur leurs utilisateurs. Et avec autant d'utilisateurs et autant d'informations, leurs politiques et leurs actions peuvent avoir une influence considérable. Twitter, qui a banni plusieurs utilisateurs très connus de sa plateforme, en est un exemple. Cela a conduit certaines personnes à reprocher à l'entreprise de restreindre la liberté d'expression.  #digitalregulation #transformationnumerique #digitalsovereignty #innovation #transfonum #technologie #transformation #gafam #leprince #machiavel #digital #intelligence #entreprises #digitalgovernance   Poke Gabriel Stéphane Koch Pierre-Alexandre Kleiber Décideurs Magazine - Groupe Leaders League  Chrysostome Nkoumbi-Samba, MBA Luigi Matrone Giuliano Liguori Pierre Berendes Jean-Henry Morin Jean de Dieu GBENOUTIN BADE Stéphanie Bretonnière  Jonathan Chan Isabelle Piel Vincent Champain Edith JolicoeurEmmanuel Chiva Cédric DENIS-REMIS Hervé Grandjean Éditions des Équateurs Gilles Ruffieux Portail de l'Intelligence Économique Aline Isoz Chrysostome Nkoumbi-Samba, MBA Stéphane Séguin Giuliano Liguori Ecole de Guerre Economique – EGE  Aimé Mukuma Reine Toungui Dominique Bruno Haden Nathalie KIENGA Kriss Brochec  Digital entrepreneur Dr. Kany Toure noelle van der waag-cowling Abdul Hakeem G.Modeste MIOKO D. author: Anthony BURATTO
content: L’audit informatique est un incontournable pour toute entreprise !  Les changements et les évolutions de votre structure informatique ne sont pas toujours sans conséquences…   Pour un système d’information vous apportant croissance et compétitivité  c’est un audit informatique qu’il vous faut !     Vous bénéficiez ainsi d’une évaluation précise de l’ensemble de la structure informatique et de 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗲𝗶𝗹𝘀 d’optimisation.    Concrètement, les principaux avantages sont :   Une optimisation du fonctionnement et de la sécurité de vos systèmes  Une amélioration de la productivité et l'expérience collaborateurs  Une meilleure maîtrise des coûts et des budgets    Rendez-vous dans l’article ci-dessous  pour découvrir encore plus d’informations sur l’audit informatique et ses avantages.  Je vous ai également listé les différentes étapes à suivre pour un audit réussi     #audit #informatique #entreprise #cybersécurité #infogérance #IT  BA Info

author: Fernando A.G. Alcoforado
content: A CONTRIBUIÇÃO DA ENGENHARIA AO PROGRESSO CIENTÍFICO E TECNOLÓGICO    Fernando Alcoforado*    Este vídeo tem por objetivo demonstrar que a Engenharia moderna se caracteriza pela aplicação generalizada dos conhecimentos científicos à solução de problemas dedicando-se, basicamente, a problemas da mesma espécie que a engenharia do passado, porém, com a característica distinta e marcante que é a aplicação da ciência. É sabido que a Engenharia está presente em todo o setor produtivo, a saber: nas fábricas, nos canteiros de obras habitacionais e de infraestrutura, nas universidades, nos laboratórios científicos, nos centros de pesquisas tecnológicas, nos transportes, na geração de energia, nas comunicações, na produção de alimentos, entre outros empreendimentos. As grandes mudanças que vêm ocorrendo na vida das pessoas, no mundo moderno, foram geradas pela tecnologia que é alimentada pelo conhecimento acumulado e os grandes investimentos em pesquisa e inovação. A humanidade precisa da Engenharia porque é ela que transforma o conhecimento acumulado em universidades e centros de pesquisa, públicas e privadas, em produtos e serviços disponibilizados à sociedade. A transformação do conhecimento produzido em laboratórios por profissionais de várias áreas, inclusive engenheiros, cabe aos engenheiros projetar e realizar. Não é à toa que em todas as definições da engenharia, e são muitas, encontramos as palavras “aplicação prática de princípios científicos visando à transformação da natureza com economia de recursos”.    * Fernando Alcoforado, 82, condecorado com a Medalha do Mérito da Engenharia do Sistema CONFEA/ CREA, membro da Academia Baiana de Educação, engenheiro e doutor em Planejamento Territorial e Desenvolvimento Regional pela Universidade de Barcelona, professor universitário e consultor nas áreas de planejamento estratégico, planejamento empresarial, planejamento regional e planejamento de sistemas energéticos, é autor de 15 livros abordando temas como globalização, desenvolvimento econômico e social no Brasil e no mundo, aquecimento global e mudança climática, energia no mundo e no Brasil, as grandes revoluções científicas, econômicas e sociais, ciência e tecnologia e cosmologia.

author: Béatrice Héraud
content: Bonjour à tous, on se retrouve pour l’édition #8 de la news de la transition écologique #LeGrandEcart avec un spécial climat ! Au sommaire :    L’alerte : entre alerte et « optimisme prudent », que nous dit le 3ème volet du #GIEC sur l’atténuation ? Trois infographies et un article de Céline Guivarch dans  The Conversation France pour tout comprendre.   La campagne : une (grosse) place pour un programme climat, SVP ! Il reste une semaine, on lâche rien     L’envers du droit : Ce n’est pas un poisson d’avril. Cinq énergéticiens dont certains disent avoir compris « l’importance de la transition écologique » attaquent des Etats européens pour avoir mis en place des mesures climatiques qui entravent leur business. Ou comment gagner du temps de business as usual…  La tendance : les scientifiques eux, choisissent de plus en plus la rebellion. Face à l’urgence climatique et l’inertie des dirigeants, des climatologues, sociologues, géographes, biologistes et autres sortent de leur neutralité et se lancent dans la désobéissance civile avec Scientists Rebellion   La belle histoire : le loto, ça veut rapporter gros et faire du bien à la planète ! La preuve avec la fondation Anyama abondé par un gagnant anonyme et dirigée par Max Thillaye du Boullay avec Jonathan Guyot   Les formations : parce qu’on a toujours besoin d’en savoir plus sur le climat (et ses liens avec les autres problématiques environnementales et sociales), on se plonge dans les ateliers, formations et modules qui foisonnent et nous donnent les clés pour agir ! Eco-Learn Juliette Nouel La Fresque du Climat La Fresque du Numérique Fresque de la Biodiversité Collège des Directeurs du Développement Durable (C3D) Pour un réveil écologique   L’initiative : Lutte pour le climat et empowerment des femmes, même combat pour Les Impactrices, le réseau qui monte pour accélérer la transition écologique et inclusive et qui nous donne rendez-vous le 7 mai à l’ Académie du Climat - Ville de Paris   Le livre : La compréhension du changement climatique passe aussi par la force du récit et pour cela je vous conseille Climax de Thomas B. Reverdy   Le festival : le festival Deauville Green Awards récompensera les meilleurs films sur l’environnement en juin prochain. Vous avez jusqu’au 29 avril pour envoyer le vôtre !   L’illustration : Voting for future, le bestiaire de l’isoloire par l'artiste Luisa Brando   La voix des experts : Vous saurez tout sur le GIEC avec le podcast de l’Iddri et vous comprendrez pourquoi le changement climatique est un symptôme d’un problème environnemental beaucoup plus vaste selon Dennis Meadows.   Merci pour votre lecture et n’hésitez pas à partager et à commenter cette news pour qu’elle puisse grandir et vous informer sur la transition tous les 15 jours

author: Médiathèque Alliance_Française_Kaolack
content: Le pôle médiathèque de l'Alliance française de Kaolack comprend cinq (3) espaces dédiés respectivement : ·        Aux adultes, ·        Aux jeunes adultes, ·        Aux enfants, Mais également un salon de lecture et une salle de ressources documentaires électroniques.  Publics visés :  Tous âges et toutes catégories socio-professionnelles.  Fonds documentaire Notre fonds est constitué de plus de 5 000 ouvrages dans divers domaines dont philosophie, religion, sciences humaines et sociales (sociologie, science politique, économie, droit, administration publique, problèmes et services sociaux, éducation, commerce, communication, transports, coutumes, savoir-vivre, folklore), langues, sciences de la nature, technologies, arts, littératures (africaine et française, largement approvisionnées d’œuvres aux programmes sur des genres littéraires tels que le roman, la poésie, le théâtre, le conte, les nouvelles, etc ; mais également des critiques et analyses littéraires), histoire, géographie, bandes dessinées pour enfants et adultes, des usuels (dictionnaires, encyclopédies, etc.) Une cinquantaine de nouveautés littéraires tous les ans.   Un coin pédagogique, comme l’indique son nom, renfermant des ouvrages pédagogiques dans presque toutes les matières enseignées, du préscolaire à l’élémentaire, et du collège au lycée, sans oublier l’enseignement supérieur.  Une bibliothèque de l’apprenant pour les apprenants : tous niveaux confondus (DELF : Diplôme d’Études en Langue Française et DALF : Diplôme Approfondi de Langue Française)   Nos ressources numériques :  Une bibliothèque numérique (Culturethèque) : la bibliothèque en ligne de l’Institut français offrant à nos adhérents la possibilité d’accéder à plus de 200 000 documents (livres-texte et/ou audio, presse internationale, périodiques, documentaires, études du français et d’autres langues étrangères, musique, etc.)  17 tablettes sont mises à votre disposition pour les activités numériques (jeux vidéo, coding…)  Activités gratuites pour nos adhérents :  Pour les adultes : débats d’idées, rencontres littéraires, cafés philo, concours d’écriture, etc. –Pour les enfants : jeux ludiques, activités numériques, ciné-enfant, heure du conte, activités artistiques, jardinage, tambour génie, séances de lecture, rencontres avec…

author: Cristina Michicin
content: Le papier blanc de Sylvain Bureau, professeur chez ESCP Business School,  «Méthodes Agiles : Pourquoi et comment en finir avec l’hyper-focalisation sur les clients ? » m’a inspirée pour un court article sur les thématiques de Focus Client (#ClientCentricity), de l’Innovation #innovation et du mindset  Lean-Agile #leanagile   Pour un cours sommaire de mon article et du papier blanc :  Pour optimiser l’existant, focalisez-vous sur le client.  Pour innover, basez-vous sur la création de la valeur future pour l’entreprise et la société.  Comme solution pour l’innovation, l’auteur vient avec la technique d’Art Thinking.   Je vous propose une technique encore plus simple, qui garantit la création de valeur et des nouveaux produits, voire de l’innovation disruptive : Les jours d’innovation en entreprise (#innovationdays ) .   Les méthodes Agile restent performantes ; la différence reste dans la façon d’utiliser ses « outils ».     Je vous invite de lire l'article et le papier blanc et de partager vos opinions pour débattre le sujet.

author: Najib BENSBIA
content: L'Arabe face à la sclérose de l'Esprit et l'indigence gouvernante !  Pourquoi nos bibliothèques nationales et assimilées sont de très pâles figures comparées à celles des pays européens ? Cette question pourrait paraître superflue tant Europe et Afrique sont inconciliables en tous points de vue. Tout de même, à voir les rayonnages, les hauteurs et on ne parle même pas des contenus des bibliothèques européennes et américaines, pourquoi s'étonne-t-on alors du fossé nous séparant !   Cette interpellation n’est pas une interrogation demandant réponse. Elle est l’expression de la structure même façonnant nos esprits respectifs ainsi que la manière dont nous ordonnançons le savoir et l’intellect. La différence entre nous et eux part du livre, pour toucher l’essentiel des étages de notre culture de la lecture, donc de la réception de la connaissance. Un peuple qui ne lit pas ou subsidiairement est voué à la paresse, à la ménopause de l’esprit et à l’atrophie de l’imagination. Sans imaginaire, ce qui est le propre existentiel du livre, le rêve perd toute la latitude nécessaire à dessiner les contours de notre présent, en tirant profit de notre passé et en entrevoyant le tracé de notre devenir, proche ou lointain. Dans cette lamentation, nous rechignons pourtant à ressasser cet épiphénomène chantant le passé glorieux de la civilisation arabe, morte et enterrée il y a des lustres et que les guerres fratricides ont fini par démembrer au fil de confrontations bêtes et amorphes...  Lire plus :

author: alain dongho
content: Peu importe dans quel environnement hors-route, vous évoluez et vous roulez gagnant. Là ou un Iveco TRAKKER ou  ASTRA passe, un chemin existe. Qu’il s’agisse de cailloux, de boue les contraintes sont là pour être maitrisées. Iveco ASTRA passe là ou les autres s’arrêtent. Pour maximiser la sécurité, il faut minimiser les risques. C’est dans ce but que les camions Iveco ASTRA et IVECO TRAKKER sont dotés de technologies innovantes, qui rendent l’exploitation quotidienne la plus sure possible. Rien n’arrête les véhicules Iveco ASTRA destinés aux applications sévères, sauf si c’est le conducteur qui décide. Dans les voiries et en tout-terrain, il faut pouvoir compter sur le conducteur pour qu’il maitrise au mieux l’environnement il trouve dans la cabine tout ce qu’il lui faut. Aucun compromis n’est possible : c’est l’un des crédos d’engagement du Groupe Premium Bénin dans l’accompagnement de la SGDS-GN en matière de formation et Recyclage des conducteurs

author: Annick Bureaud
content: Some exciting news from the Leonardo/Olats Residencies Residents   Most art residencies asks for a project and most of the time on a specific theme. For the Maison Malina Residencies with Leonardo/Olats I took the opposite approach: no theme, no topic, no obligation for production of any kind.  The results are quite exciting, I must say. Here the first one to be announced, more to come! Enjoy! Best Annick  Adsum, the New Space Artwork by Eduardo Kac to launch on February 19th 2022. Adsum will fly on an Antares 230+ rocket from Wallops Flight Facility, Virginia, to the International Space Station.    Watch it live! https://lnkd.in/emN2uQhr Northrop Grumman is targeting liftoff of its Antares rocket no earlier than 12:39 p.m. EST / 18:39 CET Saturday, Feb. 19, from NASA's spaceport on Wallops Island, Virginia.   From the artist's website: "Adsum is a cubic glass sculpture inside of which letters are laser engraved. The letters are positioned one in front of the other, thus forming a spatial poem inside the solid glass cube that can be read in any direction. 'Adsum' means “I am here” in Latin, as used to indicate that the speaker is present (equivalent to the exclamation "here!" in a roll call).  To create this space poem, I developed a new typeface in which the letter “N” takes the form of an hourglass and the letter “S” has the shape of the infinity symbol. This is so in order for the work to be legible from any point of view within the cube. The two other letters, which stand between “N” and “S,” are a lowercase “o” and an uppercase “O” (evoking the Moon and the Earth, respectively). Taken together, it is always possible to read either NoOS or SOoN in three dimensions". https://lnkd.in/e_QUsg5W     Adsum was publicly presented for the first time at the EuroMoonMars workshop, November 18-20, 2019, realized at the European Space Research and Technology Center (ESTEC), Noordwijk, Netherlands. Adsum will fly to the ISS with the support of the Stichting Moon Gallery Foundation. Adsum was conceived and produced in 2019 during a Maison Malina Residency in Paris, curated by Annick Bureaud and organized by Leonardo/Olats with the support of Fondation Daniel & Nina Carasso.

author: Naully Nicolas
content: #Clausewitz, un général prussien qui a combattu #Napoléon, a littéralement écrit le livre sur la guerre. Publié en 1832, un an après sa mort, "De la guerre" est considéré aujourd'hui encore par les experts militaires comme l'étude définitive de la guerre. Ses idées restent largement enseignées dans les écoles militaires et sont, plus que jamais, essentielles pour le stratège moderne.  La #stratégie est souvent mal comprise et donc mal appliquée. Plus que toute autre discipline commerciale, elle souffre d'une confusion paralysante et d'une complication excessive. En fait, l'essence de la stratégie est d'une simplicité étonnante, et c'est là que réside son pouvoir.  Commençons par la question de base. Pourquoi avons-nous besoin d'une stratégie en premier lieu ? Clausewitz nous donne la réponse. La stratégie est la réponse nécessaire à la réalité inéluctable des ressources limitées. Aucune entité, quelle que soit sa taille, ne dispose de ressources illimitées. La stratégie consiste donc à faire des choix sur la façon dont nous allons concentrer nos ressources limitées pour obtenir un avantage concurrentiel. Tout le reste en découle.  #stratégie #transformationnumerique #leadership #digitalstrategy #strategyandtransformation #strategicthinking #pensestrategique #darwinismenumerique #transformationnumerique #digitaltransformation #delaguerre  Poke Gabriel Stéphane Koch Pierre-Alexandre Kleiber Décideurs Magazine - Groupe Leaders League  Chrysostome Nkoumbi-Samba, MBA Luigi Matrone Giuliano Liguori Pierre Berendes Jean-Henry Morin Jean de Dieu GBENOUTIN BADE Stéphanie Bretonnière  Jonathan Chan Isabelle Piel Vincent Champain Edith JolicoeurEmmanuel Chiva Cédric DENIS-REMIS Hervé Grandjean Éditions des Équateurs Gilles Ruffieux Portail de l'Intelligence Économique Aline Isoz Chrysostome Nkoumbi-Samba, MBA Stéphane Séguin Giuliano Liguori Ecole de Guerre Economique – EGE  Aimé Mukuma Reine Toungui Dominique Bruno Haden Nathalie KIENGA Kriss Brochec  Digital entrepreneur Dr. Kany Toure noelle van der waag-cowling Abdul Hakeem G.Modeste MIOKO D. author: Vincent Ducros
content: Face à l’urgence climatique, faire la transparence sur l’impact réel de chaque activité sur l’environnement est absolument indispensable. Pour que les organisations se transforment et pour que les investisseurs soutiennent prioritairement les actifs les plus nécessaires aux objectifs climatiques mondiaux, sur une base consolidée et partagée.  C’est l’objectif fixé à la nouvelle taxonomie européenne. Chez Getlink, nous prenons les devants en présentant dès aujourd’hui non seulement le taux d’éligibilité mais aussi le taux d’alignement de nos activités, c’est-à-dire le niveau de compatibilité avec les critères exigeants de la taxonomie.   Car avec la taxonomie nous disposons enfin d’un indicateur qui parle du présent, qui valorise la contribution à la décarbonation aujourd’hui et pas seulement des promesses plus ou moins étayées à 10, 20 ou 30 ans !  En 2021, 86% de notre chiffre d’affaires est aligné avec cette nouvelle taxonomie. Ce chiffre redit l’utilité fondamentale des activités de Getlink face à l’urgence climatique et leur place dans le développement de la mobilité durable. #eutaxonomy #taxonomie #Getlink #Eurotunnel #Europorte #Eleclink #transitionecologique #green #financedurable #sustainablefinance #rail #ferroviaire #greenbond #ESG #RSE #CSR #environnement #environment

author: Axel Darut
content: Back from US and the "Sustainability in Packaging US"event organised by Smithers, thanks a lot for the invitation.   The opportunity to exchange on the legislative and regulatory challenges surrounding the circular economy in Europe and Asia, specially the deployment of EPR schemes, eco-design legal requirements for packaging and progress in terms of collection and recycling.  Circular economy challenges in the United States are really dynamics with the structuring of EPR schemes, particularly in Maine and Oregon, with strong challenges relating to eco-design compiled with an eco-modulation - a similar dynamic with the one we know in Europe with the revision of the packaging and packaging waste directive.   I'm looking forward to follow the legislative and regulatory development in the United States, with ten other American states having draft bills on the table concerning the implementation of EPR schemes !  Thanks to Smithers - Brittany Onslow - Lauren Wolford for the organisation of this great event, really happy with the meetings I had with the stakeholders from the value chain in US We look forward to meeting again to co-construct solutions to answer to these policy challenges.

author: Philippe Blanchard
content: If you think bioresource composites are an alternative, If you think innovation is the path, If you think ecodesign is mandatory, If you believe sustainability is not an option THEN join us! • as a candidate for the specialised Mastère programme of ESB (initial or vocational) • as an expert sharing your knowledge (providing a lecture or coaching a group of our students working on real-life problems) • as a company who has a problem/challenge linked to material use (allow our students to work on your project or hire one of them as an intern)  The specialised Mastère Biosourced Composites: Innovation and Eco-design is a 1 year programme taught in English. The teaching method for the first 6 months is learning by doing, problem solving and transdisciplinary and the second 6 months is project based within a company. The third session of this opportunity to make a difference will start 19th September 2022. Improve your company’s competitivity by contacting us: mark.irle@esb-campus.fr  or franck.michaud@esb-campus.fr Dedicated website https://lnkd.in/gmwwuXn8 #biosourced_composites #specialized_mastère #innovation #ecodesign

author: Mathilde TENENT
content: ((version FR en commentaire))   Dear Network,  Dear Ms,  Dear Sir,    Please don't pass by, I only ask for a few minutes of your attention   How about an industry that makes eco-designed products?  An industry that releases very little to no CO2 emissions and guarantees a healthy living environment for all?  All this seems impossible to you? The word "impossible" is not in my vocabulary, this is the challenge I want to take up!   Currently a general engineer student at CESI in Bordeaux (France), I pay particular attention to current global issues and I am convinced that our society, in constant evolution, needs innovation to meet its growing needs. That's why I am very sensitive to the development we could bring to today's and tomorrow's generations in order to live in a better world!    As part of my training, I have the chance and opportunity to do an internship abroad from September which will allow me to discover new aspects of the engineering profession and to familiarize myself with the English language.   Besides the professional side, I am looking forward to getting to know a new country, a new culture and to meet new people.     When ? 19th September 2022 to 27th January 2023. Where ? In an English speaking country (England, Scotland, Wales, Ireland, USA, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, Malta, South Africa, Finland, Norway,...)  In what type of company? An industry   In what field of activity? It doesn't matter (automotive, aerospace, medical, food processing, cosmetics, textile, construction, ...)    In which field? Environmental, sustainable development also known as the Health, Safety and Environment (HSE) field.  My role? To study and optimize the life cycle of products, to limit their carbon impact by implementing means of accounting for emissions, action and prevention plans, control, communication, and awareness. All this while promoting, at most, renewable energies and eco-design.   Maybe you will be able to help me in this great quest and will be part of the people who will contribute to my career path!    Thank you for your time and consideration.   Reachable by phone at +33 632685974 or by email at mathild.tenent@gmail.com    Many thanks,  TENENT Mathilde

author: Nicolas Coupry
content: From the choice of the paper, to the font, the print technique, the type of ink or even the size of printed materials, designers and printers are increasingly aware of their environmental impact. In order to educate and inspire around eco-design and eco-print, this category aims at showcasing projects designed with sustainability in mind.  Whether you have used carbon neutral papers, such as Olin Paper Origins or Pergraphica, upcycled papers (Refit from Favini) or recycled creative papers (such as those from Arjowiggins) or chosen #craddletocraddle certified papers (like those from Munken Paper), or selected Cocoon or Cyclus, we invite you to share your projects with us!  To discover more about the competition and its many prizes or to submit a project, visit http://ow.ly/qNqZ103yyqu  Video by Maud Vantours on Curious Metallics from Arjowiggins  #AntalisCreativePowerAwards2022 #ACPA2022

content: I’m very proud to announce the launch of our new Livebox 6. author: La Maison de la Maille
content: Ils l’ont fait. Relever le challenge, pas fastoche, de s’inscrire dans le sillage des marques reconnues pour leur éco-conception. Ils l’ont fait, c’est aussi le nom de la rubrique de Ecodesign (plateforme digitale de Refashion ) qui met en lumière les Maisons de textiles soucieuses de leur impact sur l’environnement et actrices dans cette dynamique. Désireuse depuis ses balbutiements de toujours tendre vers un processus de fabrication éthique, La Maison de la Maille est aujourd’hui reconnue pour ça. Hélène Daret, directrice Pôle Marques chez Refashion, nous en parle.   --   They’ve done it. Risen to the challenge – and not an easy one at that - of establishing themselves as brands renowned for their eco-design. “They’ve done it” is also the name of the section of Ecodesign (the Refashion digital platform) that shines a light on those textile maisons that are mindful of their impact on the environment and are doing something about it. Since its beginning, La Maison de la Maille has been eager to always tend towards an ethical manufacturing process, and it is now recognized for this. Hélène Daret, director of the Brands Center at Refashion, talks to us about it.   #Refashion #LaMaisondelaMaille #MadeinFrance #EcoResponsable #Plaid #Throw #Interview

author: Pranav Vyas
content: WBCSD – World Business Council for Sustainable Development launched the Packaging Sustainability Framework "SPHERE" enabling companies to make informed decisions towards sustainable packaging.  - The new framework will help businesses to choose the most sustainable option for their specific packaging needs by providing an overview of all environmental impacts and the trade-offs between them.  - The framework is based on six principles including packaging efficiency, circularity, impact on climate change and biodiversity loss, absence of harmful substances and waste mismanagement.  - SPHERE can be used either at the company-level to identify potential hotspots across a range of packaging or as an eco-design approach to evaluate different packaging options for a specific product.   - The dynamic nature of the framework will allow companies to evaluate the environmental impacts of packaging in their full complexity. It will support companies in reducing their ecological footprint, set long-term packaging sustainability strategy and, accelerate progress towards net-zero and nature-positive targets.  - SPHERE has been developed in collaboration with 12 companies including several WBCSD members and with the support of an advisory group.  #packaging #sustainablepackaging #supplychain #sustainability

author: Fashion Impact Fund
content: Thank you Zofia Zwieglinska Glossy for including Fashion Impact Fund Executive Director Kerry Bannigan's thoughts: The E.U. also published its strategy for a more sustainable textiles industry and its new anti-greenwashing measures. According to Kerry Bannigan, executive director at the social entrepreneur organization Fashion Impact Fund, brands will now need to implement measures ensuring responsibility along the value chain, including sorting and recycling products. They must also create an eco-design framework that prioritizes durability and recyclability.  “They will need to ensure the infrastructure is in place for this transition. A just transition is critical, in order to reskill workers where needed and ensure no worker is left behind,” she said. The green deal is prioritizing the creation of jobs, including in fashion, where additional roles will be needed to help brands keep to the legislation.  #fashion #design #textiles #media #impact # #sustainable

author: Infra Innovatie Netwerk
content: De tech start-up Ocean Grazer is de Winnaar van de CES 2022 Innovation Award in categorie Sustainability, Eco-Design & Smart Energy.   Ocean Grazer heeft een systeem ontwikkeld dat via een waterkrachtcentrale overtollig zonne- en windenergie efficiënt kan opslaan. Bij een overschot aan energie van de windturbines wordt een pomp op de zeebodem in werking gezet. Deze pompt uit een ondergronds reservoir water op, dat in de zakken wordt opgeslagen. Deze zakken staan onder druk door het zeewater. Wanneer er behoefte is aan energie, dan stromen de zakken onder druk leeg. Deze waterstroming wordt gebruikt om turbines aan te drijven waarmee elektriciteit wordt opgewekt.   Een groot voordeel van het systeem van Ocean Grazer is dat het kan meegroeien met de capaciteit van de windmolenparken. Het opslagsysteem kan bestaan uit meerdere geschakelde, op zichzelf staande eenheden. Bovendien zijn er geen zeldzame aardmetalen nodig voor deze vorm van energieopslag. De ambitie is om uiteindelijk te kunnen concurreren met conventionele opslagsystemen.   Meer weten over de prijswinnaar? Lees verder via onderstaand artikel. #energie #energietransitie #energieopslag #innovatie

content: Quantifying and reducing the environmental impacts of IT is one of the greatest challenges I have been tackled for several years now, working with EASYTEAM (Constellation Group) and ID Capture. Hence, it is important to focus on software eco-design when IT efficiency is at stake.  In this blog post, I will try to give some elements to help you understand some of the main concepts and challenges of software eco-design. author: Dr Subramanian Senthilkannan Muthu, PhD in Textiles Sustainability
content: Call for Potential Authors for Publication of Scientific Books by Springer- Nature- Book Series: Sustainable Textiles: Production, Processing, Manufacturing & Chemistry- Series Editor: Dr Subramanian Senthilkannan Muthu  Interested Authors can reach out to me directly by a PM.   This series aims to address all issues related to sustainability through the lifecycles of textiles from manufacturing to consumer behavior through sustainable disposal. Potential topics include but are not limited to: Environmental Footprints of Textile manufacturing; Environmental Life Cycle Assessment of Textile production; Environmental impact models of Textiles and Clothing Supply Chain; Clothing Supply Chain Sustainability; Carbon, energy and water footprints of textile products and in the clothing manufacturing chain; Functional life and reusability of textile products; Biodegradable textile products and the assessment of biodegradability; Waste management in textile industry; Pollution abatement in textile sector; Recycled textile materials and the evaluation of recycling; Consumer behavior in Sustainable Textiles; Eco-design in Clothing & Apparels; Sustainable polymers & fibers in Textiles; Sustainable waste water treatments in Textile manufacturing; Sustainable Textile Chemicals in Textile manufacturing. Innovative fibres, processes, methods and technologies for Sustainable textiles; Development of sustainable, eco-friendly textile products and processes; Environmental standards for textile industry; Modelling of environmental impacts of textile products; Green Chemistry, clean technology and their applications to textiles and clothing sector; Eco-production of Apparels, Energy and Water Efficient textiles.  Sustainable Smart textiles & polymers, Sustainable Nano fibers and Textiles; Sustainable Innovations in Textile Chemistry & Manufacturing; Circular Economy, Advances in Sustainable Textiles Manufacturing; Sustainable Luxury & Craftsmanship; Zero Waste Textiles.  #sustainability #circulareconomy #recycling #textile #environmental #supplychain #technology #manufacturing https://lnkd.in/gD9hPhRS

author: Rod Devlin
content: Plato said “Our need will be the real creator”   The crisis in Ukraine has undoubtedly gifted the EU with a renewed sense of purpose and a powerful accelerator for greater integration and closer cooperation. Today’s Versailles Declaration by the EU Heads of State or Government takes a decisive step towards building European sovereignty. It sets out an ambitious agenda and timeline for the European Institutions in the following key areas: Bolstering EU defence capabilities; reducing energy dependencies; building a more robust economic base by reducing the EU’s strategic dependencies in sensitive sectors – critical raw materials, semi-conductors, health, digital technologies and food security. The 10/11 March 2022 Versailles Declaration is attached below.

author: Stephan Winkelmann
content: The last 2+ years have not been business as usual: a global pandemic, shortage of semi-conductors, now the war in Ukraine…  For me as the CEO in such a situation it is the first priority to create stability for the employees and their families, for our business partners and suppliers, for our customers. I’m proud to announce that Automobili Lamborghini S.p.A. is continuing its stable growth, recording the best first quarter in our history in terms of deliveries, following the best year on record for the company.  In such uncommon times it is difficult to make a forecast, but Lamborghini is starting the year from a very strong position.  #Lamborghini #automotive #CEO

author: Thomas Mengel
content: En klassiker, når vi taler om "Fede Firmabiler". Den super fine Volvo V60.   Vi lever lige nu i en tid, hvor bilbranchen er vendt fuldstændig på hovedet. Absurde leveringstider pga. mangel på mikrochips (semi-conductors), ledningsnet som bliver produceret i Ukraine, mangle på stål osv. osv. Priserne stiger generelt, brugtbilspriserne stiger, hvilket i den grad påvirker beskatningsgrundlaget, når det skal genberegnes efter 3 måneder.   Intet er som det plejer at være, men V60'eren er stadig en fed firmabil. Der er kommet dugfriske beskatningsgrundlag, hvilket betyder at en V60 T6 Recharge Core (plug-in) starter fra ca. 481.000kr., og en B4D Plus Bright (diesel) starter fra ca. 503.000kr.   Leveringstiden hedder fra Q1 2023 og fremefter. That's the name of the game pt., desværre.   Tak til Pedersen og Nielsen Automobilforretning A/S / Mikkel Ols i Aarhus for udlån af den fede Volvo!   #FedeFirmabiler #Volvo #Opendo

author: Naveen Chintalapudi
content: I have many questions regarding solar energy that frequently pop up in my mind...  Is there so much of #Solar  Energy that is not being captured and getting wasted on a daily basis? (I have studied energy can’t be created or destroyed and can only be transferred from one form to another form).   What if large areas of deserts are filled with solar panels? [referring to the ones where currently it is not being done]. Also, a point here, I have read that there will be some impact on global #climate  because of the heat reflected by large scale solar panels (from a study conducted on Sahara Desert).   What happens if the top of every vehicle (possible one’s) is installed with a small feasible solar panel? [At least, to use the stored energy to power small viable devices]  Why is there much lesser adoption? Is it because of huge initial costs? Is it because of manufacturing problem (something related to semi-conductor industry)? Is it because of cost of storage of energy?  Put down your thoughts in the comments and do correct me if I am wrong.  By the way, I captured this picture using my mobile from my running college bus 5 years ago. -#Mr_Perfect

author: Future Energy Exports CRC
content: Announcement: Another natural advantage in waiting. Australia's #helium endowment is not being realised. Why does this matter? Helium is in short supply globally and is already listed as a critical commodity by the Australian Government. When we think of natural gas developments, we don't necessary consider the high-value gases that are being accessed. Helium is one of those gases - essential for the medical industry and for both purging and finding leaks in systems designed for high pressure hydrogen. It's also required to make fibre optics, semi-conductors and arc welding: the list of uses is long.   In this latest publication from Future Energy Exports CRC, Luke McElroy and team discuss Australia's helium endowment and how helium recovery can be achieved at low marginal cost given the base infrastructure is already in place https://bit.ly/3OdmHOm #endowment #australia #gas #helium Department of Industry, Science, Energy and Resources Gongkui Xiao, PhD, MIEAust, CPEng Roman Weh Eric May

author: Han-Jun Zeng
content: South Korean conglomerate Samsung made an sudden and unexpected move that caught many analysts off guard, that...  ...is to make technology and patents transfers to the Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs), free of charge.   This has never happen before but industry watchers are of the view that this move would encourage even more South Korean large enterprises to follow suit  thereby further strengthening the country's competitiveness in the global technology race.   Based on the controlled releases of patents and technology, industry watchers believed that the technology transfers would spur new innovations in the areas of ESG, sustainability, verification, tracking and semi-conductor.   You can read more at the attached article.   Please help to like, share and comment if you think that the content is actionable for you, your organization or someone within your network. Appreciate your kind gestures.   #ESG #Sustainability #AsiaPacific #Technology

author: Y.Y Jung
content: JOB posting of Nanotech Digital GmbH   -English   Nanotech Digital GmbH is an expert in thin film process technology such as evaporation, sputtering, and CVD. Since 2016, Nanotech Digital has focused on Industrial Engineering Technology. Through our experience in equipment and process engineering we develop roll to roll process technology coordination for transparent electrode film by utilizing graphene application manufacturing. Based on our equipment engineering specialty, we distribute equipment and components such as Graphene Application, Dry Pump energy saving products, X-ray Detector Film manufacturing equipment, and sputter for LED process and packaging process, SiC Components, Special Coating Engineering Service, 3D X-ray inspection System and Tabletop SEM throughout Europe.  Nanotech Digital GmbH specializes in battery-related equipment and semi-conductor equipment, parts, and materials. Nanotech Digital GmbH is a startup established in 2016 and is a small but strong company. It is a member of the SEMI Europe Board, a member of SEMI policy decision directing group, and was chosen as one of the eighty-eight up-and-coming startups in Germany.  Recently, Nanotech Digital GmbH began expanding into new business areas and is collaborating with mid-size to large-size companies, including a few in Korea. We are currently working on establishing European branches) with these companies and plan to build manufacturing plants locally. To accommodate the growth of the company, Nanotech Digital GmbH is seeking to hire full-time, contract-worker, mini job (part-time), and praktikum (internship) positions.   #Nanotechdigitalgmbh #https://lnkd.in/dtHsRNy #SECEurope #www.tabletopsem.com #www.automatedxray.com #www.rfplasmagenreators.com #www.perovskiteworld.com
