author: Nicolas MARIOTTE
content: Alors que les ­industriels espéraient au début de l’année que les problèmes d’approvisionnement en puces élec­troniques allaient progressivement se résorber et que les volumes de production allaient retrouver leur ­niveau d’avant-pandémie, d’autres composants comme les faisceaux électriques, ces enchevêtrements de fils électriques connectés au bloc-moteur, souvent fabriqués en Ukraine, sont venus à manquer. Les écrans, les lève-vitres électriques aussi. De plus, le Covid, que l’on croyait avoir jugulé, repart en Chine, ce qui a conduit les autorités à reconfiner et à fermer les usines. Les fabricants de composants et les sites des constructeurs, comme Tesla et ­Volkswagen, qui s’y sont installés pour profiter du ­premier marché mondial de l’automobile, sont touchés. L’industrie automobile se retrouve donc à nouveau plongée dans les affres de l’approvisionnement en composants électroniques. Pour achever le tableau, la hausse du prix de l’énergie est venue alourdir les coûts de production déjà bien plombés. Les fournisseurs de pièces de fonderie et de forge sont dans une impasse. Innovation et autonomie  Sans surprise, les constructeurs ont donc relevé leurs prix au fil des mois. La hausse la plus specta­culaire est signée Tesla.  La note de son modèle électrique d’entrée de ­gamme, la Model 3, a grimpé de plus de 6 000 euros, à 49 990 euros, en quatre mois ! De manière plus discrète, tous les constructeurs ont changé leurs étiquettes, d’abord en début d’année, puis au printemps. En moins de trois ans, le groupe Emil Frey France, premier distributeur automobile en France, cons­tate que le prix moyen des véhicules neufs de 27 marques a ainsi progressé de 15 % (+ 13 % pour les véhicules d’occasion).  « Tous les trois mois, nous assistons à des hausses de prix de quelques centaines d’euros, observe Stephane CALDAIROU, son directeur général. Les constructeurs répercutent leurs hausses de coûts des matières premières sur leurs tarifs. » Ainsi, en deux ans, l’achat d’une Peugeot 208 à essence neuve s’est renchéri de 2 670 euros (12,4 %) et de 3 170 euros (14,7 %) si l’on tient compte de la suppression des gestes commerciaux. Le prix d’entrée de la BMW Série 1 est passé de 25 450 euros en octobre à 27 300 euros aujourd’hui. Cette tendance va se poursuivre : plutôt que de sacrifier leurs marges, les constructeurs feront supporter les hausses de coûts à leurs clients. Les ventes de véhicules électriques continuent à progresser mais elles comptent 30 % de composants électroniques en plus. Et avec un coût de batterie en hausse, l’écart de prix avec les voitures ne va pas se réduire aussi vite que prévu.  La mutation du thermique à l’électrique va alourdir le coût par unité de 1 535 euros. Si les surcoûts de l’électrique n’étaient pas absorbés par une hausse de la productivité, le coût pourrait même atteindre 2 603 euros par véhicule.

author: Burak Agirbas
content: JOB OPPORTUNITY - MEDIA SALES MANAGER - AMAZON ADS  Vous trouverez ci-dessous le descriptif du poste. Si ce poste vous intéresse, merci de m'envoyer un message en privé avec votre CV.   DESCRIPTION  Vous serez responsable du développement de l’activité publicitaire d’un portefeuille d’annonceurs de moyenne à grande taille et leurs agences, existants ou à prospecter, en gérant la relation à tous les niveaux hiérarchiques. A travers une approche consultative, vous proposerez des solutions publicitaires sur desktop, mobile, et notre réseau programmatique. Vous avez une forte expérience commerciale dans le marketing digital, de préférence dans le domaine de la vidéo, ainsi qu’une grande rigueur et capacité d’organisation nécessaires pour créer des relations de confiance dans un environnement innovant. Si vous vous reconnaissez, postulez dès maintenant !  Vos responsabilités inclueront notamment : La compréhension des produits et outils Amazon Advertising pour aider à la recommandation de solutions pertinentes aux clients d'Amazon. La croissance de l’activité avec des clients existants. La prospection et la création de nouveaux partenariats avec les annonceurs, les agences, et notamment les équipes multi-screens La collaboration étroite avec les équipes partenaires internes (account management, marketplace, retail, etc.). Bâtir une connaissance de l’industrie du e-commerce et de son environnement concurrentiel. L’utilisation d’outils CRM pour piloter votre activité commerciale.  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor´s or master´s degree, preferably in sales/marketing Several years of sales experience, ideally in the advertising, media or agency landscape, and proven track record of reaching and exceeding sales revenue goals via new and existing business. Ability to work cross-functionally and with a wide range of employees with different skill sets in a highly dynamic, rapidly changing environment. Able to utilize Sales CRM tools such as Salesforce or like program. Strong ability to independently deliver against short term immediate goals and long term strategic objectives. Excellent organizational, interpersonal, as well as written and verbal communication. Strong attention to detail with a data driven approach to providing solutions. You have exceptional analytical skills acquired from previous experiences. Business fluent English and French.  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS You already worked in an international environment  Merci !

author: Salma Essid
content: L’intuition, l’observation et l’empathie.   Lecture du jour  !  « le fabricant d’automobiles Henry Ford l’avait parfaitement assimilé lorsqu’il a lancé cette phrase : « Si j’avais demandé à mes clients ce qu’ils voulaient, ils auraient répondu “un cheval plus rapide”. Cela explique pourquoi les méthodes classiques comme les groupes témoins et les questionnaires dans lesquels on demande seulement aux gens ce qu’ils veulent fournissent rarement des informations pertinentes. Les études de marché traditionnelles peuvent servir de base à des améliorations incrémentales, mais elles ne mèneront jamais à ces innovations de rupture qui changent les règles du jeu, modifient les paradigmes existants et semblent si évidentes que nous nous demandons pourquoi personne n’y avait pensé avant. Notre objectif ne se résume pas à satisfaire des besoins manifestes en inventant une imprimante plus rapide ou un clavier plus ergonomique ; ça, c’est le travail des designers. Il consiste plutôt à aider les gens à formuler des besoins latents dont ils ne sont peut-être même pas conscients.  Voila le défi qui attend les adeptes du Design Thinking.  Comment devrion-nous l’aborder ?  De quels outils disposons-nous pour passer des modifications incrémentales modestes aux intuitions fulgurantes qui boulverseront la donne ? »   Tim Brown, L’esprit Design, Le Design Thinking change l’entreprise et la stratégie.    #design #designthinking #change #entreprise #empathie #stratégie

author: Ruben Sigoura ☁️
content: Notre génération est en train de gagner.   Nous sommes en train de comprendre que l'argent, la carrière, le pouvoir, la gloire ne fait pas tout. Nous avons vu des gens plus âgés qui ne sont pas heureux et regrettent leur vie.  Dorénavant, le Saint-Graal se trouve dans la liberté qui est primordiale dans un monde ouvert. Nous avons compris que notre temps sur terre est limité.   Je vois certains articles parlant de la generation Z. Ils ne comprennent pas une seule chose.   Que l'épanouissement passe par le bien être du salarié des missions intéressantes et surtout la liberté d'agir. L'exigence change de coté et c'est une bonne chose pour tous.  "Le fait que les employés soient plus exigeants envers leur employeur est essentiel au bon fonctionnement du capitalisme. C'est un moteur de prospérité et cela favorise un environnement plus compétitif pour les employés talentueux, poussant les entreprises à instaurer un cadre de travail plus agréable et innovant pour le bien-être de leurs collaborateurs, mesures qui leur permettront en retour de dégager des bénéfices plus importants pour leurs actionnaires" Larry Fink Ceo de BlackRock dans sa lettre aux dirigeants.  Nous sommes en train de gagner et ce n'est que le début..

author: Anton R.
content: Bitcoin est-il un jeu d'échecs en temps réel et une révolution pour les systèmes de paiement?   Le gambit du roi a été, sans conteste, LA grande ouverture du XIX° siècle (et avant). De Greco à Anderssen, on estimait que c'était la seule façon correcte pour les Blancs de jouer immédiatement pour le gain.  Grâce à un petit pion, les blancs ouvrent une partie intéressante car le joueur débutant doit, avant toutes choses, affûter ses armes tactiques, apprendre à calculer, exciter son imagination.  C’est ce que Jack Mallers a fait avec Strike et le Lightning Network, avec comme adversaire les grands réseaux de paiement comme Visa et Mastercard.   - Jack Mallers, le jeune PDG de Strike (27 ans), annonce que Strike sera aujourd’hui intégré avec Shopify pour proposer aux marchands d’accepter les paiements via Bitcoin et le Lightning Network  - Il revient sur l’histoire des réseaux de paiements et explique que les réseaux de paiements tels qu’on les connait comme Visa et Mastercard n’ont pas innové depuis les années 60  - « Nous sommes persuadés qu’avec Bitcoin en tant que LE réseau de paiement principal, le système financier sera moins cher, plus rapide, plus innovant et plus inclusif »  - “Bitcoin est un réseau de paiement supérieur, c’est un fait. Qu’il vaille 10$ ou 10000$, ça ne change rien”   Une vidéo à regarder ABSOLUMENT sur le futur des systèmes de paiement, drôle et avisée !  lien vers la vidéo: https://lnkd.in/eEw6FmrG #bitcoin #change #network #innovation #crypto

author: Monia Merabet
content: Body positivity and diversity are core movements in the beauty industry. Men and women around the world see more body shapes or skin colors represented than ever. While there is still a lot to do for everyone’s beauty to be included and valued, these trends are already creating tangible changes.   One of them concerns the hair segment. For a long time, straight hair was a beauty standard for many, leading women with curly hair to use chemical treatments and excessive heat to get sleek locks, sometimes damaging them in the process.  In Africa a natural hair care movement where women are embracing their curls is growing. For instance, ’natural curls were once looked down upon in Egypt, where Western beauty standards favored sleek, straight locks. Now, things are changing, as it does in several other countries.’  What’s your take ? Let me know in the comments ?  #trendforecast #forecasting #futureinsights #inspiration #trends #beauty #beautytrends #innovation #beautyindustry #consumerinsights #haircare #bodypositivity #inclusivity #diversity

author: Aliyyah Abdullah
content: Ever wonder how finance professionals can support a lean enterprise culture at a manufacturing firm?  They can by:  1. Eliminating non-value added activities and minimizing duplication and waste 2. Avoiding reliance on manual processes throughout the shop floor  3. Participating or encouraging greater involvement of employees 4. Supporting investments in shop floor training 5. Avoiding decisions based on old data and not having a system that captures up to date information 6. Identifying the root causes of problems and variances e.g. poor planning leading to poor inventory management 7. Enabling greater contact with internal customers and external customers 8. Supporting an innovative culture such as product innovation (R&D), flexible production lines (smaller batch sizes), process innovation (changes in the production process), and organizational innovation (alliances/joint ventures) 9. Benchmarking against competitors  Many of these activities originate from the 5S Model and is part of lean methodology where, the objectives of the model are to reduce waste, improve productivity and remove variation.  The 5S Model can be broken down into:  Sort – Discarded or re-used for later Simplify – Putting items in the most suitable place Scan – General observation or maintenance Standardize – Having standards and procedures in place to avoid the guesswork of shop floor workers Sustain – lean and continuous improvement is not a one-off exercise rather a routine  As always lean principles can be applied to the finance department and is a source for quick wins. What else would you add to this?  #leanmanagement #supplychain #finance #accountingandaccountants #financegeek #

content: With new #players emerging in the world of #payments, along with rapidly changing customer demands, the pressure is on to collaborate and develop faster, more efficient, innovative, and transparent cross-border payment solutions. This week we focused on what’s new regarding cross-border payments:  Firstly, TerraPay has secured a money services business (MSB) license in the US, augmenting its cross-border payments infrastructure.   In LATAM, EBANX and VTEX have teamed up to broaden cross-border payments for Brazilian #ecommerce companies.   Besides, Goldman Sachs Transaction Banking (TxB) and Form3 have announced a new solution that delivers FX and payments capabilities to Form3’s banking clients. Form3’s platform will leverage TxB’s cross-border payments and Foreign Exchange (FX) execution capabilities to introduce a value-added service for Form3’s regulated financial institution customers.  It was also a prolific week as Coda Payments has raised USD 690 million to enable cross-border payments for #games and other #digital products, as well as alternative app stores; and Leatherback has secured a USD 10 million pre-seed round for its cross-border payments solution.

author: Livio Andrea Acerbo
content: Regulatory Uncertainty Is A Barrier For Wider Bitcoin Adoption | Mint on  #greengroundit Uncertainty about how cryptocurrency regulation will roll out in the future, particularly in the U.S., remains a significant barrier for wider adoption of digital assets such as bitcoin, said panelists Wednesday at one of the largest bitcoin conferences of the year.    But speakers at the Bitcoin 2022 conference in Miami Beach, Fla., were optimistic that more policy makers and regulators were seeking to better understand the technology and to support innovation in the sector. Consumers being able to pay for products and services with crypto is seen by many in the industry as a path to wider acceptance of digital currencies. But one major reason more merchants aren’t offering crypto as a payment method is regulatory uncertainty, according to a report presented at the conference by cloud-based payments platform Checkout.com. The report, based on a survey of 3,000 businesses across 10 countries, mostly online marketplaces, financial technology and e-commerce, said that regulatory uncertainty would endure, as the creation of national legal frameworks for regulating crypto has been relatively slow and uneven. Mike Novogratz, chief executive of investment firm Galaxy Digital, said the attitude in Washington regarding moves to crack down on cryptocurrency has begun to change. “The president’s executive order really had a change in tone recently. It was a change in tone from being negative to being balanced," Mr. Novogratz said Wednesday. President Biden last month signed an executive order that directed federal agencies to report on digital currencies and consider new regulations. Although the order outlined the risks cryptocurrencies pose to the economy, national security and climate, it also noted its potential economic benefits, unlike many previous government pronouncements on the topic. Bitcoin’s price surged on the day the executive order was announced, signaling that the industry generally welcomed the change in tone from the government. Mr. Novogratz, a former Fortress Investment Group fund manager and an early investor in bitcoin, said he doesn’t see new crypto legislation coming out this year. “The way politics are set up, we’re going to be in gridlock, but I think the chance of them really damaging things has gone way down," he said. He said the change in tone in Washington came after the crypto community mobilized over the infrastructure bill last year, which aimed to boost tax enforcement on crypto transactions. While the crypto industry wasn’t able to change the legislation, the unified effort illustrated the young industry’s growing influence in Washington and finance. Mr. Novogratz said that at the time he placed calls to every senator he knew. “That was the wake-up call," he said, referring to the large number of phone calls against the provisio…

author: Mario GUILLO PhD
content: Chapter 7: why the SmartUniversalSpindle-GM001 is so Smart ?  How is it possible to reach large welding capabilities in a such compact size ? It is the first question of my customers when they see the SUS-GM001 for the first time. Nothing happens by chance, everything has a meaning.  A lot of things have been taken into account during the denifition and the design. Complete finite element analysis, but also static and dynamic bearing calculation, like critical speed and resonance analysis was done. Bearing life properties has no sense if this criterion is not coupled with others. One of this on the following picture, with dynamic herzt pressure analysis on balls bearing. After that, we do a complete correlation between simulations and tests in FSW and SSFSW, based on our experience. A lot of sensors have been integrated into the spindle heart, bigdata management in real time, allowing to improve our models. Currently we are able to simulate every situation to validate real welding conditions.  For the user, it's the same thing to weld at a 1000 rpm and 10 000 rpm, only a simple input to change, but to reach a such result in reality, it is a little bit more complicated...  15 kN of axial forging force and 5 kN of radial forces in FSW until 10 000 rpm, it's a technical truth ! 3 patents covered our knowledges.  Each detail has been taken into account, the best for robotic FSW and SSFSW (and more!) .  Soon available, a lot of new options ! Vision and camera visualisation in a dynamic and open environment, innovative automatic tool change in the same spindle volume and a lot of big surprises during 2022 and the beginning of 2023.  Please feel free to contact me if you have any further questions.  #FSW, #SSFSW, #fswp, #friction, #stir, #welding, #weld, #spindle, #spindlerepair, #sensors , #fanuc, #fanucrobotics, #robotics, #robots, #milling, #MAUPERTUIS, #FrictionStirWelding, #stationaryshoulderFSW, #battery, #electricalvehicles, #industrialdesign, #industrialrobots, #industrialrobotics, #aluminiumindustry, #aluminium, #automation, #automotiveindustry, #aeronautic, #RoboticFrictionStirWelding, #bigdata, #dataanalysis

author: Philippe DELERIS
content: New blog post on development and climate action! #climatechange #development #growth   The response to climate change has to be not only efficient but also fair. And both efficiency and fairness require that climate action does not slow down development and poverty reduction in poor countries. In fact, rapid and inclusive development can reduce people’s vulnerability to climate change, potentially halving the number of people that will fall into poverty due to climate change by 2030.   In order to tackle climate change, the world’s richest countries certainly need to step up and do much more.  But to stabilize climate change, all countries – including low- and middle-income countries – will need to contribute to bringing global net carbon dioxide emissions to zero. For countries and decision-makers questioning whether this transition is possible today, here is some good news: there is an increasing wealth of evidence that climate action does not threaten economic growth.  In fact, many of the trades-offs of the past — when greener options were more expensive — have disappeared, creating unprecedented opportunities for green growth.  https://lnkd.in/dZBEBDgZ

author: Latha Koumar
content: National Data Strategy : Secure consumer data-sharing   The introduction of Open Finance in the UK in the coming years is essentially a certainty. Secure consumer data-sharing is a key objective of the UK Government's National Data Strategy.   If designed and implemented effectively, Open Finance will be a crucial enabler of increased competition and innovation in financial services and enhance consumer choice and financial capability. But in achieving these benefits, it will also inevitably disrupt traditional financial market structures and business and revenue models. Yet, in our experience, many firms are still unclear about some of Open Finance's key concepts, timelines, and potential impact on financial services. Above all, firms are unsure about which challenges and opportunities Open Finance will present for their own businesses and how - and when - to start preparing for it.  Role Of Banks (TPP) in Future Payment Ecosystem  : Open Finance: preparing for success  Retail Banking Order mandated Open Banking. Account Service Providers (ASPs) – or data holders – will likely be required to put in place and maintain secure Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) to share data with TPPs – or data receivers – at the customer's request. The FCA expects that TPPs will need regulatory authorisation to operate.  While the exact impact of Open Finance will vary by firm and use case, we have identified some general strategic considerations:  Changes to traditional market structures – TPPs could increasingly control the primary customer interface and weaken the customer's relationship with ASPs. One-stop-shop solutions for multiple account management, better product comparison tools, easy switching, and balance sweeping solutions are likely to erode customer stickiness. In the absence of a clear Open Finance strategy, ASPs could be relegated to a utility through inaction rather than choice.                                              Pressure on traditional income sources and increased costs - increased competition and customer churn could potentially put pressure on firms' revenues and reduce cross-sell opportunities for ASPs without a clear Open Finance strategy. Technology costs will also increase for both ASPs and TPPs. ASPs will have to build, test, and maintain APIs – either in-house or through a third party. TPPs will need to invest in connecting their systems to the ASPs' APIs or buying API connectivity services from an external provider.                                    Data competitive advantage – TPPs' competitive advantage will grow due to the ability to access data held by ASPs and generate insights through advanced data analytics capabilities. This means Open Finance will erode traditional ASPs' historical advantage – albeit often untapped - of holding large customer datasets.  What is the regulatory timeline for Open Finance?   The-Smart-Path-to-Open-Finance-Sept-2021.pdf

author: Hong Guo
content: HR is the key in healthy development of a business. HR professionals are the key stakeholders in the development of strategy and in support of operations. They take care of people and leaders. When it comes to the enterprise’s attractiveness to new talents and to maintain talents, HR professionals are the image of a business. Internally and externally, their implication determines the collective capacity and enterprise’s future. Yet, they are short of time for self-care.  A survey reveals a shocking result: a high percentage of HR professionals, as high as 98%, are in risk of burn out. I hope this figure is not true or it’s a figure at a spot moment, driven by the Covid pandemic, by the challenges from hybrid working, by the sudden wave of big quit, and by a few other factors. Although they have undoubtedly accelerated the process, all those factors may not be the fundamental driving force for this high burn out.  Why then?  Since some years, the rocking development of new technology starts to cast impacts on the life and on the work of people, consequently causing changes in our society and casting anxious impacts on each one of us and on our organizations.  These challenges are not comparable to those seen in our history before. For an organization to thrive and to excel in these waves of challenges, the traditional centralized or even sub-centralized HR practices cannot effectively answer the call from people and business facing those challenges any more.  How to handle?  Those impacts are calling for new HR practices and people strategy, so the business can keep its competitiveness while people can find the balance between their well-beings and their work. Those challenges calls for integrated yet redistributed HR management practices, covering all HR domains: talent attraction, talent retention, team management, collective innovation, diversity management, employee and customer inclusion, enterprise CSR, and many more.  The new HR management practices are nevertheless not sufficiently adopted. Both top managements and HR professionals are not equipped yet to answer the call from people and from business. Thus, facing those challenges without the tools neither empowered enough nor prepared mentally, this high number of burn out rate among HR professionals shows the first consequence within the business today. The derivative consequences are yet to be seen on business’ competiveness, on the rest of the organization and on people.  What to do?  Join one of our workshops to find out distributed HR practices.   #HR, #burnout , #talentacquisition #diversityrecruitment #inclusionanddiversity

author: Corina Burton🌼
content: I didn’t go to business school.   I didn’t major in marketing.   I actually didn’t from graduate college.  I had zero experience in branding, let alone online social selling.   Starting literally from the bottom at 28 years old, financially and workspace experience.   I was terrible at sales when I first started in my career 12 years ago.   What I DID to change my life in my career and ultimately to become a successful entrepreneur today DESPITE my past circumstances.   Learned from the school of hard knocks & what it taught me (daily!! Listen and you too will learn).   How to be resilient.   Become a professional high quality multi-tasker (motherhood).   Know how to make a dollar stretch and budget (and boy I sure do).   How to cry and allow myself to feel my feelings (do not suppress, exhale and release!!) but never stop putting one foot in front of the other.   Be creative in problem solving- not only in business but personal life.    Always thinking innovative and outside the box.   Build relationships authentically in business (all of my experiences can relate to so many DIFFERENT people).   Understand the difference between selling and becoming a solution specialist, then putting into action.   Create a journal that blends business goals with mindset, gratitude, daily actions and manifesting dreams into reality (yes I wrote it  ).   A lack of “paper” saying what I am an expert at did not stop me from utilizing what LIFE can hand us if we want to change our circumstances.   Defy the odds of what anyone says you’re not “qualified” for and become that unstoppable person you’re meant to be.   Circumstances do not define your future, your choices do.   Become #unstoppable Corina Burton CPR Construction Cleaning #entrepreneur #marketing #business #construction #branding #mindset #career

author: Daniel Nascimento
content: The most valuable companies are obsessed with their end users. Looks simple in theory, but incredibly challenging in practice.  Why?!?!?!  Usually big companies perform brand extensions, customer research, product managers create a proposition with designers and engineers to specify a product, and manufacturing to deploy products to the market. Nevertheless, customer mindset can get lost on this cycle when we move to Customer Experience layer.  Customer Experience goes beyond product expectations to surprise and delight while being as accessible as possible - while big companies still has specific roles to focus on shifts to optimization, missing from time to time the passion for creating things that are USEFUL and DESIRABLE to customers.  (the famous PUSH and PULL innovation battle by companies)  Insights, technologies, data, etc., are all fuel for the innovation process, but it’s enabled teams with full consumer experience goal that will disrupt or increment different parts of consumer journey value, even industry-leading solutions, for the marketplace.  Make Cross functional teams work together and have the big picture of Experience meaning by target customers before specialized activities performed on silos, or changes/ innovations will not be perceived by customers on silence mode.  #innovation #experience #productcycle

author: Butterfly Works
content: We would like to congratulate and welcome to our Supervisory Board two new members, Edith and Susan! We are grateful and excited to have them join the Board and bring their unique talents, expertise and perspectives to the work of Butterfly Works, in order to further our vision of creating a world in which people have a say in the future they want. Meet our newest butterflies...  Edith van der Spruit has worked with PUM Netherlands senior experts, a volunteer organisation, since 2012. She works as an expert in the textile design sector and gives advice to SME’s in emerging markets and developing countries. Edith is also a member of the Ethical Commission. Prior to this, she was the country coordinator for Sri Lanka for PUM and the CEO of WO=MEN Dutch Gender Platform, a unique international lobby platform that addresses human rights and specifically, unequal (power) relationships in the field of gender and sex.  After her studies at the Academy of Visual Arts in The Netherlands, Edith lived in French-speaking Africa for more than ten years. During this time, she inspired women to rebuild their lives as entrepreneurs, after years of violence and war. She developed forms of micro credit and local savings systems that are still used to this day.  After completing her Master’s degree in Public Administration and Communication, Edith worked as the Director of Social Development in several municipalities. In 2012, she returned to Africa to be the Country Director for Oxfam Novib in Eastern DRC.  Susan van Esch has 20 years of experience at the intersection of social development and culture. Trained as an anthropologist, Susan approaches social issues from different perspectives and strongly believes in bringing unexpected parties together for sustainable change and innovation. She previously did this for organisations such as Oxfam, Cirque du Soleil, Dance4Life and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Inclusion and participation of the target group, especially young people, is a special focus in all her projects. Susan is currently head of the Master's program Crossover Creativity at HKU, where creativity is used to tackle societal challenges. Trains, travel and reading are amongst her favourite things to do, particularly when combined.  Thank you to all who serve on the Board, and we look forward to working together to advance our work within the international development sector.

author: Fernando Jefferson
content: SOFTWARE IS IMPACTING THE WORLD! FEEDBACK-LOOP is FASTER THAN EVER!   Historically, stories of breakneck growth involved either computer software, which offers nearly unlimited scalability in terms of distribution…    OR… Software-enabled hardware, such as the Fitbit fitness tracker or Tesla electric car, whose software component allows the company to innovate on software timescales (days or weeks) rather than hardware timescales (years)!    Moreover, the speed and flexibility of software development allow companies to iterate & recover from the inevitable missteps of haste!   What’s especially exciting these days is that software and software-enabled companies are starting to dominate industries outside of traditional high tech!    Marc Andreessen has argued that “software is eating the world.”    What he means is that even industries that focus on physical products (atoms) are integrating with software (bits).    Just like Tesla makes cars (atoms), but a software update (bits) can upgrade the acceleration of those cars and add an autopilot overnight.   The spread of software and computing into every industry, along with the dense networks that connect us all, means that the lessons of “quantum-growth-hack” are becoming more relevant and easier to implement!    Even in mature or low-tech industries!   To use a computing metaphor, technology is accelerating the world’s “clock speed” (the rate at which Central Processing Units [CPUs] operate),    making change occur faster than previously thought possible!   Not only is the world moving faster, but the speed at which major new technology platforms are being created is reducing the downtime between the arrivals of each wave of innovation!    Before that, individual waves would sweep through the economy one at a time—technologies like personal computers, disk drives, and CD-ROMs.    Yet today, multiple major waves seem to be arriving simultaneously—technologies like the cloud, AI, AR/VR, not to mention more esoteric projects like supersonic planes and hyperloops.    What’s more, rather than being concentrated narrowly in a personal computer industry that was essentially a niche market, today’s new technologies impact nearly every part of the economy, creating many new opportunities.   This trend holds tremendous promise!    Precision medicine will use computing power to revolutionize health care.    Smart grids use software to dramatically improve power efficiency and enable the spread of renewable energy sources like solar roofs.    And computational biology might allow us to improve life itself.      “Quantum Growth-Hacking”  can help these advances spread and magnify their sorely needed impact without being eradicated by competitors and hijackers + without dealing with a complex hierarchy bureaucracy like a rigid corporation.   *If You are Interested to Rapidly Scale-Up Your Ventures, Let’s See If You are a Great Fit!   #founders #software #tech #startup #saas #unicorn #ipo #owner

author: Nagakarthik MP
content: Farmers across Meghalaya (And the other regions of the North East) are seeing a reduction of yield from their crops owing to a multitude of reasons including land use patterns, choice of crops, monoculture, youth leaving the region in search of opportunities etc. A majority of them farm on the slopes and practice traditional methods of shifting cultivation.   Shifting cultivation, though usually badgered by academia and research for the practice of slash and burn actually continues to be one of the most sustainable ways in which farmers can continue to practice subsistence farming that allows multi-cropping, agroforestry resulting in a constant cycle of market linkage and food security.   A lot of efforts take the route of mandating that farmers stop shifting cultivation without looking at a contextual alternative.   In the last month, we have been working together with David Gandhi to spread awareness and build a pilot around a contextual and participatory process for Sloping Agriculture Land Technology (SALT) farming. The goal is to introduce this technique in collaboration with the Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) funded projects with MEGHALAYA BASIN MANAGEMENT AGENCY   The goal is to follow a farmer field school approach to help farmers with a contextual alternative that benefits the land, soil, farmers and ecology at large.  The response from the farmers has been very encouraging which is one the main reasons for us to have an aspiration to scale this project towards a Payment for Ecosystem Services structure.   What we are building at Sauramandala Foundation is essentially a learning layer for the state of Meghalaya, with at a team that works across Health, Education, Livelihoods, Energy and Ecology that is trained to identify and understand the problem statements well, we are then able to provide rich insights, access to the ground, government partnerships to the sector at large and have an impact on policy level changes, pilot implementations, innovations and helping our partners scale. The coming years look exciting with the launch of a series of Youth Centers and a rural focused fellowship program that launch by the end of the month.  Rainmatter Foundation Sameer Shisodia #SALTFarming #climateaction #soilhealth SauraMandala Foundation #sdgs2030 #ruraldevelopment #agriculture

author: Deepti Thomas
content: Earlier this week, I was celebrated as part of the new class of Partners, Principals and Managing Directors of Deloitte. Forgive the sentimentality that follows -- I rarely get personal on a professional forum, but an occasion like this warrants some mush!   I joined Deloitte 15 years ago right out of campus, joining what was then the AERS Innovation team based in India. Joining an innovation team in an offshore delivery center for what was then predominantly an audit support practice was by all accounts a non-traditional choice. However, whether it was ignorance or hubris that got me here, it has been an immensely rewarding and enriching experience.   I joined the firm completely green, having never had any professional experience. But in it I found a home. One where I was nurtured, encouraged, supported, and celebrated. Where skills I didn’t know I had or didn’t value much were carefully cultivated. Here I found mentors, sponsors, and champions; people who opened doors for me, and were always in my corner. A place that made room for my off-beat role and enabled me to flourish. I am filled with immense gratitude to those who have shaped this journey.  Deloitte also made room for changes to my life. Never have I felt like my opportunities were limited, or my potential undervalued because of choices I was making in my personal life. In fact, I attended my final interview for the MD promotion just a few weeks before I had my baby, I got the call letting me know I was promoted while I was on (a very generous) maternity leave, and I spent my first few months as MD away from work caring for a new child.   Above everything, Deloitte has offered me the opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest people I’ve ever known, and there is no better motivator than that. Each day, I’m buoyed by the efforts and brilliance of a fabulous team who goes above and beyond. Their commitment, and dedication makes me want to be a better person and a better professional.  So I fully appreciate the honor of being included in the leadership of this organization. An incredible, thoughtful, human organization.

author: Weng Ban, FONG
content: I watch a lot of advertisements everyday on my phone.  Yes, the 15 or 20 or 30 seconds sponsored ads when I am using an app or playing a mobile game.  I notice a change in presentation of these ads.  Ads that promote two brands within 30 seconds instead of a single brand.   It could be 20 seconds of brand A and 10 seconds of brand B, or 17 seconds of brand C and 13 seconds of brand D, as long as the ads use up a full 30 seconds.  Why such a change?  Innovation could be the name, but I guess it is to maximize the exposure of brands by spending less within the limited time.  Have you noticed this similar trend as well?  Change is always happening in this world, and the same goes to investing world.  Most banks and fund houses have sped up their online investing processes due to Covid-19 pandemic.   Are you aware that you can invest in financial products from different banks and fund houses using a single platform with lower sales charges (some even have 0% sales charge), instead of having to open multiple banking and investment accounts?  And yes, you can also switch to other investments within the same platform if you are not happy with your existing investments, at no additional cost!  You even have the control to choose the right advisor to serve you and manage your money and investments.  And do you know that this change has already happened since more than 10 years ago, and yet you are still not aware of it?  Find out more from me if you want to know and change.  #money #investing #ManageMoneyWithWengBan

author: Matt Sorg
content: Six months ago I’d enter a meeting “Tell me how to make money on your chain”   Today “I have this problem that I think blockchain can solve. <insert very well thought out situation here>”   Good companies work backwards from the customer problems, the greatest companies see trends and understand how to get ahead of them. Blockchain’s open data and verifiable ownership are powerful. They don’t automatically fix a problem that translates into revenue, but it does allow for everything from ownership of virtual goods to single sign on without giving any one entity all the data/visibility.   Great to see people think of innovative ways to utilize this for their product innovations. Eventually this will change hearts and minds of users/players who are justifiably still skeptical.  #blockchain #blockchaingaming #product #productdevelopment #productinnovation #nfts #change

author: Leslie Dwyer
content: USE DISCERNMENT...  Pleasant Greetings, Friends.  Today's post is inspired by David Wee, about friends and how you make them.  BTW, David is an thought provoking and insightful leader on this platform, and I learn and glean from him regularly.  Thank you for sharing the gift of yourself with me and this community, David!   RELATIONSHIPS MATTER.  I think we know it but can take this fact for granted.  Success comes from relationships.  People get involved in personal, academic, or professional projects with individuals they know, love, and trust.  Proverbs 18:24 talks about a friend who sticks closer than a brother.  I think we can use the word friend too liberally.  IMHO, we do the same for the word love or excellent, etc.  If an individual, such as yourself, has good, close, intimate friends...and I mean these are the folks who "do LIFE with you" and, especially "REAL LIFE", meaning when trouble, trial, challenge, or adversity punches you in the gut - expectedly or by surprise...you are REALLY BLESSED!  Real friendship requires relationship, and that takes work.  I ASK YOU:  Nowadays, do people really want to put forth that effort?  I hope so because we are hardwired by GOD to be relational, to be better together.  My best friend's son said recently that real friends can be hard to come by at school because some people hang out with you and then flake (leave you and not care).  This is sad yet it is also real life, and we must know how to handle it.  Be discerning.  Covid caused life to change dramatically and rapidly.  With it also came positive changes (remote work, innovation, etc.) and isolation, loneliness, and health issues.  I highly recommend that each of us utilize discernment.  Discernment is the ability to judge well.  For me, that ability comes from reading Proverbs and The Bible.  The Bible Is GOD'S Book of Success, and is full of Wisdom.  And, pursuing Wisdom has its benefits...but that is for to discover independently and for another post.  Take actor, writer, director, producer, Tyler Perry's advice and learn to appreciate who and what people are:  a leaf, a branch, a tree (roots).  And, if people who want to walk out of your life and relationship with you:  Be thankful for that season (of relationship), LET THEM GO, and keep your Peace.  To learn more about Tyler's analogy, click on the link in the Comments.  It is wise counsel!  I welcome your thoughts in the comments.  #MyLovelyPeople #succes #leadership #mindset #relationships

author: masterlyassignments
content: New Post: 1017 - https://lnkd.in/dhwNPZJf.    Assignment Instructions LITERATURE REVIEW Overview  For this assignment, you will develop a condensed literature review on a topic you chose. The literature you select should be relevant to a current issue, problem, innovation, change, or trend in your field or specialization. My Specialized Field is Healthcare Administration     Writing a literature review is a key part of academic work. A literature review is a piece of writing that describes what has been learned about a topic through previous research efforts. The literature review is essentially a report on work previously done in a field, to show an understanding of the context for your own writing.  Your literature review should include a minimum of five references from peer-reviewed journal articles related to your field or specialization.   Literature Review Guide  A literature review is not a summary of individual sources in a list, such as in the form of an annotated bibliography. Instead, the literature review should integrate in-text citations within the paragraphs to support your analysis of the scholarly readings you selected. You will seek key themes from the different scholarly journals.  Use Academic Writer for guidance in citing sources and formatting your paper in proper APA style. See the Evidence and APA section of the Writing Center for instructions on accessing and using Academic Writer.   Critical thinking: Be sure to analyze and evaluate the articles, not just report what was written. What should you add?  Integration: Integrate information from across the sources in your review. Look for themes and commonalities. Do not just review one article after another in a linear fashion. Use headings and subheadings to organize your paper around themes you identify.  Review of the rubric: Apply critical thinking to analyze scholarly articles and point out conflicting evidence or perspectives. Apply critical thinking to evaluate scholarly articles and identify criteria used for evaluation. Synthesize information to identify missing information that limits understanding of the topic.  Critical Thinking Examples  Apply principles of critical thinking to analyze scholarly articles and point out any conflicting evidence or perspectives. For example:   "Articles X and Y (citation) promote a constructivist approach, which is in direct contrast to the behaviorist approach advocated in article Z (citation)."  Apply principles of critical thinking to evaluate scholarly articles and identify the criteria used for the evaluation. For example:  "There is a weakness in the inference made by the author (citation), as the conclusion of XXXX was not clearly supported by the data." "The author (citation) never clearly defined the concept of XYZ."  Synthesize information gathered in a review of scholarly literature and identify any missing information that limits understanding of the topic. For example:  "The five artic

author: Monila Kothari
content: After a fantastic 12 years leading the Givaudan APAC Taste and Wellbeing team and 20 years with Givaudan I will be "retiring" from Givaudan end of 2022.This is not new news for my team but it is for the rest of my community. This decision was not led by COVID but something that was in the works since 2018 led by both personal and professional reasons .I feel very lucky to have had the opportunity to work with my fantastic team ,build the future of food and develop the leaders of tomorrow with an eye on diversity and inclusion. And I now even have a flavour created in my name  by our very own Ben Kranen ,Principal Flavourist from a description coming from the team !My heart is full of gratitude, it is full of pride . This journey would not have been possible without my mentors ,leaders, peers and team.  There is so much exciting innovation happening today in the biotech, foodtech and pharma fields and Singapore is a great place to be in the middle of this environment. I plan to stay engaged with the corporate world in a different avatar post December 2022. Till then, I have some exciting strategic projects at Givaudan and the first Women in Leadership program in the division to kick off and mentor !  #leadership #change #newbeginnings2022 #diversityandinclusion #innovationecosystem

author: AAREP ATL
content: AAREP ATL recognizes James “Jay” Bailey as a Pillar in the CRE industry.  Committed to living by his personal motto, “Build As We Climb”, change agent, thought leader, entrepreneur, and emerging philanthropist, James M. Bailey has dedicated his life to serving others.   James serves as President and CEO of the Russell Innovation Center for Entrepreneurs (RICE). Honoring the great legacy and visionary business leadership of Herman J. Russell, Sr., he will lead the development of the largest center in America, dedicated to empowering Black entrepreneurs and small business owners; over 50,000 square feet designed to inspire ideas, create jobs, grow companies, and increase wealth in the community.   An Atlanta native and die-hard Georgia Bulldog, James has a proven track record of success, recognized by 3 U.S. Presidents for his leadership and community efforts. In 2012, James was one of eight Americans honored at the White House as a “Champion of Change: Following in the Footsteps of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.”  Dedicated to service, James is a National Point of Light Award and Presidential Lifetime Volunteer Service Award recipient. James has served on numerous boards including the Metro Atlanta and the Georgia Chamber Board of Directors, the Atlanta Beltline TAD Advisory Committee, a Georgia Forestry Foundation Trustee, and Chairman of Citizens Trust Bank’s, Next Generation Advisory Board.   A graduate of Leadership Georgia, Leadership Atlanta, and the Regional Leadership Institute, James was also named to both the Atlanta Business Chronicle and Georgia Trend Magazine’s “40 Under 40 Best and Brightest Leaders of the Future”, while Atlanta Magazine recognized him as one of the city’s most powerful leaders.   He is a recipient of the coveted Whitney M. Young National Community Service Medallion, the Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Drum Major for Service Award, a New Leaders Council Fellow, member of Alpha Phi Alpha and the 100 Black Men of Atlanta.    Thank you Jay Bailey for leading the way in the Construction industry and helping make room for the next generation.  #jamesbailey #hjrussellinnovation #aarepatl #weopendoors #minoritiesincre

author: Sridhar Sidhu (He/Him/His)
content: It’s #official. One more #Patent is granted to our team at Wells Fargo. I’m equally glad to be part of this grant covering a very critical innovation.  While #Innovation is an #IndividualSport (to come up with some blue sky ideas), I always believe that “Practical” innovation has to be a #TeamSport.   Context of the patent: We (as consumers of an organization’s products and services) always have to #authenticate #ourselves to the service #agent of our service provider. Ever thought of the criticality of authenticating to each of the consumers that the #agent they are interacting with is also proved to be #authentic to avoid frauds?  We all know how rampant #authentication #frauds are across industry segments globally and how customers are defrauded. With a potential for over a trillion dollar authentication frauds (and non financial frauds), it’s time to change the approach...  My fellow innovators on our team at Wells Fargo at the time of filing this patent documentation:  Rameshchandra (రమేష్ చంద్ర) Ketharaju (కేతరాజు) Satyavathi Divadari , Vinod Mannattil

author: Jeffrey P McNulty Founder and CEO of "The Ultimate Retail Course"
content: Throughout my 30-year tenure in the retail sector, I learned to develop axioms that became "mental anchors," which afformed me the opportunity to remain centered and focused on staying true to my convictions, core values, character, and integrity.  The impetus of this axiom is don't wait until you have to innovate. By then, it will be too late. Be the aggressor by fervently pursuing innovative strategies while embracing change.   I just finished reading Patrick Bet-David's book "𝐘𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐍𝐞𝐱𝐭 𝐅𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐌𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐬: 𝐌𝐚𝐬𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐀𝐫𝐭 𝐨𝐟 𝐁𝐮𝐬𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬𝐬 𝐒𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐠𝐲," and I thoroughly resonated with his insights. His analogy of asking business leaders to think like chess players (anticipating your next five moves) is brilliant and on-point.  I created an acronym for L.I.O.N. that has served me well throughout my life: 𝐋𝐄𝐀𝐑𝐍 𝐈𝐍𝐍𝐎𝐕𝐀𝐓𝐄 𝐎𝐏𝐏𝐎𝐑𝐓𝐔𝐍𝐈𝐓𝐘 𝐍𝐄𝐗𝐓  𝐋𝐄𝐀𝐑𝐍- many businesses stop being aggressive with learning or accepting new ideas, strategies, or paradigms after becoming successful. This mentality can become a death knell for any business or leader. This is WHY I love getting older and having the ability to learn, develop, and grow continually. I am a curious and voracious learner that loves to have discussions on a myriad of diverse and interesting topics. Retail is my background, but I love to discuss business, health, society, relationships, human nature, wine, cats, and spirituality.  𝐈𝐍𝐍𝐎𝐕𝐀𝐓𝐄- the best time to innovate is when you are on top or have experienced massive success. Far too many businesses rest on their laurels and only acquiesce to accepting and embracing innovative ideas and strategies when they have no choice. Innovation is analogous to when a cornerback is covering a wide receiver "If He is Even, He is Leaving." If you are par for the course, you are exposed and vulnerable to hungrier competitors more motivated to capture your market share. 𝐍𝐄𝐕𝐄𝐑 𝐒𝐓𝐎𝐏 𝐈𝐍𝐍𝐎𝐕𝐀𝐓𝐈𝐍𝐆.  𝐎𝐏𝐏𝐎𝐑𝐓𝐔𝐍𝐈𝐓𝐘- history is littered with businesses that hand a "Kung-Fu Grip" on staying staunchly committed to their antiquated legacy mentality; Blockbuster had the opportunity to purchase Netflix (ouch). K-Mart & Sears did not think that #Target or #Walmart was a serious threat to their dominance in the 80s. Doug McMillon keeps a timeline (picture in comments) on his office wall showing the top 10 retailers from 1950 forward as a reminder to remain vigilant for opportunities.  𝐍𝐄𝐗𝐓- world-class brands are always asking what's next. Top-tier leaders are fanatical about anticipating and trusting their intuition. I believe in celebrating "mini victories"; however, after enjoying the excitement and achievements, it is back to thinking about my next 3-5 moves. While creating my online course "𝐓𝐇𝐄 𝐔𝐋𝐓𝐈𝐌𝐀𝐓𝐄 𝐑𝐄𝐓𝐀𝐈𝐋 𝐂𝐎𝐔𝐑𝐒𝐄: 𝐁𝐄𝐂𝐎𝐌𝐄 𝐀 𝐑𝐄𝐓𝐀𝐈𝐋 𝐑𝐎𝐂𝐊𝐒𝐓𝐀𝐑!" I was already planning to release 13 more courses in 2022.  WHAT IS YOUR FAVORITE AXIOM?

author: Cindy Lim
content: Sustainable palm oil production lies at the intersection of two major global challenges: climate change and food security. Two weeks ago, I joined more than 400 representatives from the Indonesian palm oil industry at a forum organized by @Majalah Sawit Indonesia, where the opportunities and challenges of being at this intersection were highlighted.  I shared a summary of our Innovation Dialogue on Sustainable Palm Oil, which explored the role of innovation in enabling a thriving, inclusive and environmentally positive palm oil sector. One of the obstacles mentioned by participants in the Dialogue was the lack of clear or sufficient incentives for many producers – especially smallholder famers – to make significant changes. As such, innovations aimed at optimizing productivity, enhancing value distribution, and unlocking natural capital value will help accelerate sustainability in the sector.   I would like to thank all the participants of the Innovation Dialogue, who have been so generous with their time and sharing of insights. At the same time, I am proud to be part of this push by Syngenta to sustainable agriculture solutions relevant and valuable to every farmer.   These solutions require partnerships and collaborations. View the report here and reach out if you have ideas: https://bit.ly/3uwkANU #InnovationDialogue #SustainableAgriculture #SyngentaforSmallholders #SyngentaProud

author: Dale R.
content: “The secret of getting ahead is getting started.”  To us, our employees are more than High Vis wearing, number crunching, project managers. Around the UK we are employing forward thinkers, paving the way for change and encouraging innovation and efficiency.  When I was first starting out in my career, I was given a lot of responsibility but very little authority. Business decisions lead to high levels of micromanaging, which left teams feeling frustrated and sometimes powerless. I soon realised that this approach was not only stifling creativity, but it was also preventing development in the skills I and my colleagues needed to be successful in our roles.  Since then, I have made it a point to empower the people I work with, whether they are direct reports or members of my team. I have found that when people feel trusted and empowered, they are more engaged and productive.  As part of our team you can contribute to shaping how we design and deliver our network  – through experience, suggestions and technology. From improving the way we interact with each other, down to the type of fibre that delivers our super fast speeds, we aim to promote opportunities to break new ground and create substance on our journey.  With 7 positions in my team being filled over the past month, we have one remaining - which could be the start of your journey at Connect Fibre…  Please connect with me directly for more details or send your CV to;  DeliveryCV@connectfibre.co.uk  *The role is Work From Home with travel when required.  *UK applicants only please. *No agencies at this time.   #technology #innovation #business #team #network #people #opportunities #projectmanagers #fttp

author: Maria Cuba
content: Today is my 11th year anniversary at Airbnb. What an amazing ride! I could have not imagined how impactful and transformational this job would be in my life. It’s been a privilege to be part of this story and to have my life tied to this legacy. I am grateful for the opportunity to lead with advocacy, innovation, inclusion and authenticity contributing to a more connected world and in service of community. Airbnb has been a place of growth, acceptance, challenge, and opportunity where I feel seen, heard and valued. The changes and growth I have witnessed in the tech space during these 11 years are a testament of what can happen when we act with intentionality, advocate for fairness and lead with intention. It fills my heart to see so many stories of transformation, contribution, innovation, and hard work marking a decade of advocacy for diversity and inclusion in tech. URGs belong in tech. We are in every successful company, we bring our values, our resiliency, our commitment and more important our empirical perspective and experiences. We make companies stronger, products better and communities more united. I am so proud and grateful for the work, and everything we have accomplished in these 11 years. And the best is yet to come! #community #job #tech #opportunity #inclusion #diversityandinclusion #latinxleaders #latinasintech #latinas #boricua #diversityintech #diversitymatters

author: Samson Tan (Dr)
content: After almost five years at NIE, I'm ready for a fresh start and a new challenge.  I spent the week reflecting on the things I learned at NIE that will help shape the rest of my career. While the list is long, a few stand out for me. Working at NIE changed the way I see education, what culture can mean, how being agile is critical for success, and how challenging the status quo should not be a luxury but a necessity. It was an incredible experience to be part of an institution that cared about its people - above all else. I learned what it feels like to work for and with people who deeply care about and support each other – in good times and in bad. I leave NIE with a full heart – one overflowing with gratitude. I’ll work hard to recreate this in the next chapter of my career.   Thank you, Prof Chew-Hung Chang, for your leadership and support. Thank you, Assoc Prof Liu Woon Chia, for bringing me to this institution when there was much work to be done. You're such an inspirational leader, and it's been an honour to work with you.   Over the last couple of years, I worked very hard to develop a leadership team that can carry the vision, mission and culture of what is today the Centre for Innovation in Learning forward. Today I believe I leave the team better than I found it.    While I will miss my friends and colleagues at NIE very much, I'm also extremely excited about my next endeavour. I'll share more about that in a couple of weeks.   Thanks for the great memories, NIE! #education #innovation #people

author: David Yoon
content: It’s already been a month since Ukraine-Russia war began. Ukraine is very important for us as I have many good friends and business groups etc in Ukraine. Importantly Ukrainian people are so kind always…   But when I saw media, most of media is not accurate. They just report only missile attacks or bombing issues as it’s easy to make headline topics. When I collected and analyzed reliable data, the situation is totally different but good for Ukrainian troops. My sources are from private institutions and reliable public data. It is obvious that Ukraine is winning totally.   In fact, right now Russian troops are isolated and surrounded by Ukrainian forces in northern zone. Especially in Kyiv area, Ukraine troops are pushing up and Ukrainian reinforcement troops arrived from the west zone. As a result, Russian troops are isolated and surrounded. It’s about time for Russian troops to be collapsed in northern zone. So ironically Russian troops are building up defense walls in Northern zone now. Kharkiv and Sumy are all safe and secured in Northern zone as well.   In Southern zone, Ukrainian reinforcement and counterattack have begun. As a result, Mylolaiv city successfully defended and counterattack to Kherson city. I estimate Kherson city will be taken and restored by Ukrainian forces in a week.   However, Mariupol city is in danger as it’s surrounded by Russian troops with immoral bombing. I think Mariupol people and defenders are true heroes in this war for Ukraine. Mariupol city and troop deterred/stopped entire Russian southern troops perfectly. Because Mariupol has sustained and deterred entire Southern Russian troops, mainland Ukraine forces have prepared and assembled strong reserve troops. As a result, Odessa and Dnipro are safe without damage as well. But this week will be a bit tough as Russian troops are regrouping for one final attack. And Ukraine troops should restore cities and territories as well.   Nonetheless, from the beginning, this war was impossible for Russia. Russia is not cable to launch a high tech war. High tech war requires semi-conductor technology in which South Korea and Japan are good at. Russia doesn’t have semi-conductor technology and electronic tactics for war. So they just upgraded their old tanks of T80 and T90 with heavy fires and armor BTG tactics. But it’s still analogue system. Some missiles don’t change any war trend…   However, since 2014, Ukraine has imported many high tech weapons and trained their soldiers with high tech warfare from Western supports. Ukraine has been innovated successfully for a decade although Russia’s been stuck by their old soviet mindset and system for decades…     This war is showing us clearly how the world has been changed in a new era by innovation and open society. It is obvious that Ukraine is winning on this war. Stay strong, Ukraine!

author: Imran Zafar
content: How many microchips are you carrying at any moment? Why do we have a shortage of #Microchips?   Your #Smartphone, Smart Watch, Bluetooth Earplugs, your car keys, and every other electronic device now require microchips.   Wide use of #5G technology and opening up Economies after the pandemic put up increased uneven demand for microchips that cannot be fulfilled with existing production capacity worldwide and delivery time goes as high as 22 weeks.   Microchips are essentially made up of #SemiConductors, the term “Foundry” is used for manufacturing Semiconductors. While “Foundries” ACA Semi-conductor / microchip manufacturers love more demand but it doesn’t help downstream companies notably Car manufacturers who lost production and revenue.    In foundries, semi-conductors are made through silicon or germanium, or other pure elements by adding other impurities. Silicon and Germanium are both chemical elements with atomic numbers 14 & 32 respectively, #Silicon is better than Germanium because it can sustain high temperatures compared to Germanium.   The process of setting up a foundry requires several years’ time, needed the most advanced robotic machinery and a highly skilled workforce, needless to mention it requires the investment of billions of dollars.   Thus only a handful of companies have production plants with Taiwan producing 63% of Semiconductors, South Korea 18%, the US 7%, China 7%, Israel, Singapore, and others a combined 6%.   While #TSMC (Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company) alone has a 54% market share, the next is #Samsung with a 17% market share.   TSMC and Samsung are the only two companies that can produce 5-nanometer chips, while TSMC claims to manufacture 3-nanometer chips in 2022.   What more facts do you know about this Industry?   #Technology

author: Rajesh Srivastava
content: ISM: Centre Plans Modernising SCL Plant For Chip Manufacturing The ISM will serve as the nodal agency for efficient, coherent and smooth implementation of the schemes As part of its effort to begin manufacturing semiconductors, the Semi-Conductor Laboratory (SCL) in Mohali is being modernised by the Centre. The Parliamentary Standing Committee on Communications and Information Technology gave a report in the House on the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology which detailed a plan on modernising the SCL unit in Mohali, saying that the government had informed the committee of the upgrade plan. The India Semiconductor Mission (ISM) will be responsible for handling the upgrade. Envisioned to be led by global experts in the semiconductor and display industry, the ISM will serve as the nodal agency for efficient, coherent and smooth implementation of the schemes. The report of the committee says the strength of India lies in semiconductors design. India is designing for the companies that comes from outside but are not making its own IP design and competing with the other companies. Last month, the Union Cabinet approved a programme of Rs76,000 crore for the development of sustainable semiconductor and display manufacturing in the country to begin the process of making chips used in display panels of smart phones, laptops, TV screens, weapon systems and automobiles. The government is aiming at setting up a semi-conductors and sensors lab and semiconductor assembly units. https://lnkd.in/gyHkEasd

author: Jean-Marc Jancovici
content: Anglo American est un géant minier opérant dans de nombreux pays pour extraire de la croute terrestre des babioles diverses qui se retrouvent ensuite partout autour de nous :  - nickel, manganèse, minerai de fer et charbon métallurgique (tout cela sert pour l'acier) - cuivre - platinoïdes (catalyseurs, piles à combustible...) - et... diamants, qui restent souvent considéré comme le "nec plus ultra" de la preuve d'amour.  Mais... ces métaux et minéraux ne sortent pas de la croute terrestre tous seuls. Il faut les y aider un peu en allant faire des trous, puis en charriant jusqu'au lieu où il sera "travaillé" (purifié, raffiné, transformé...) le matériau extrait de la mine (et qui contient en quantités variable du minerai ou des pierres précieuses et de la terre ou de la roche).  Pour ce transport on utilise souvent des dumpers, énormes camions qui peuvent mesurer jusqu'à 8 mètres de haut et dont la benne transporte jusqu'à des centaines de tonnes de matériau. Bien évidemment chacun de ces engins utilise des quantités respectables de diesel pour fonctionner.   Pour "décarboner" cette opération Anglo-American va tester des dumpers à l'hydrogène. L'opérateur affiche crânement sur les véhicules "zéro émission", et, emporté par cet élan, le journaliste de Les Echos utilise aussi cette expression. A-t-il raison ?  Poser la question c'est y répondre : zéro, surement pas. Il faut toujours fabriquer le dumper, sa pile à combustible (qui contient du platine... peut-être extrait par Anglo-American, très bien placé du coup pour avoir le bilan carbone de ce métal !), ainsi que le dispositif de production d'hydrogène, et tenir compte du rendement des opérations en chaine dans tout cela.  Application pratique juste pour l'énergie : avec un panneau solaire en Afrique du Sud le kWh solaire doit être à environ 30 g de CO2 (il est à 45 en France).  L'électrolyse aura un rendement de 70% et la compression de l'hydrogène ensuite de 80%. La pile à combustible a un rendement de 50%. Enfin le moteur électrique a un rendement de 80%. Rendement de chaine : 0,7*0,8*0,5*0,8 ≈ 22% de l'électricité à l'arbre moteur en supposant zéro fuite (car les fuites d'hydrogène sont particulièrement impactantes sur le climat).  Ca fait donc le kWh mécanique à ≈ 130 g de CO2 hors fabrication de la pile à combustible. C'est assurément beaucoup moins que le diesel. Ce dernier émet 300 g de CO2 par kWh thermique, et en supposant que le rendement du moteur est de 40% cela fait 750g par kWh mécanique à l'arbre moteur.  Cela n'aurait pas couté cher au journaliste de faire le calcul et d'écrire non point "zéro CO2" mais tout simplement "quasiment 6 fois moins de CO2". La presse économique, normalement à l'aise et précise avec les chiffres en euros, devrait se donner pour objectif de l'être autant avec les chiffres en carbone ! Ca serait précieux pour nourrir les débats...

author: Jean-Marc Jancovici
content: Je dois dire que j'ai été surpris de découvrir, à l'occasion de cette nouvelle largement diffusée (que l'Inde n'exporterait pas de blé cette année), que le pays le plus peuplé de la planète (à parité avec la Chine), et disposant de 4 fois moins de surface cultivable par personne (0,14 hectare) que la moyenne mondiale (un peu au-dessus de 0,6 hectare) était... exportateur de céréales.   De même, alors que la production de céréales par personne et par an est proche de 400 kgs en moyenne mondiale (données Banque Mondiale et graphique en commentaire), cette valeur n'est que de 220 kgs en Inde, soit 40% de moins. A titre de comparaison, cette valeur est de une tonne (de céréales par personne et par an) en France, de 1,4 tonne aux USA et de 800 kgs en Russie.  Comment un pays qui produit aussi peu (enfin relativement aux autres grands exportateurs) peut-il dégager un surplus ?  Une des explications possibles vient peut-être de l'utilisation de ces céréales : l'Inde produit 40% de viande de boeuf en moins que la France (alors que sa population est 20 fois plus nombreuse), 7 fois moins de viande de porc, et "seulement" 3 fois plus de volaille (donc en fait 6 fois moins par habitant). L'espérance de vie à la naissance y est de 70 ans.  Il n'en reste pas moins que cette décision indienne a contribué à faire grimper les prix des céréales au plafond pour les échanges internationaux. Cela va contribuer à rendre encore plus difficile l'accès (économique) à la nourriture dans les pays fortement importateurs (dont plusieurs pays d'Afrique du Nord).  Cette nouvelle n'est hélas qu'une demi-surprise : avec une population planétaire en hausse, des approvisionnements agricoles qui vont être négativement impactés par le changement climatique et/ou l'accès plus difficile à l'énergie (gaz pour les engrais, pétrole pour la mécanisation et le transport aval, gaz et pétrole pour les phytosanitaires) la seule question est de savoir à quel rythme et à quel horizon de temps on verra apparaître des tensions croissantes.  Notre nouvelle première ministre arrive pile dans une petite répétition générale de ce qui sera de plus en plus notre quotidien : des conditions de température et de précipitations pas sympathiques, un accès à l'énergie plus difficile, des chaines mondialisées perturbées, et une inflation qui va en conséquence devenir plus ou moins structurelle, du moins exprimée en nombre d'heures de travail nécessaires pour se payer quelque chose.  Nous ne pouvons pas faire grand chose à court terme en ce qui concerne la production céréalière en dehors de nos frontières. Par contre nous devrions nous doter aussi vite que possible d'une boite à outils appropriée pour anticiper et planifier avec le monde tel qu'il va être, et non tel que l'on aimerait qu'il soit.

author: Jean-Marc Jancovici
content: Meteo France fait un point de situation sur la sécheresse en France, alors que la température devrait dépasser 30 °C la semaine prochaine sur la moitié nord de la France, ce qui va évidemment accroître le stress hydrique en surface en augmentant l'évaporation : https://lnkd.in/en33QqXA  Une large partie de la France a des sols "plus secs que la normale", et si la tendance des "prévisions" saisonnières est exacte cela ne devrait malheureusement pas s'arranger cet été, avec une évolution qui devrait être à la fois plus chaude et plus sèche que "la normale" : https://lnkd.in/ecXf_CW9   Mais qu'est-ce que la normale quand le climat est en train de dériver en permanence ? Qu'est-ce que la normale quand on sait que notre pays va s'assécher dans le cadre du changement en cours, et que ce que nous observons actuellement semblera doux et humide dans 20 ou 30 ans ?  Faut-il encore parler de "normale" pour un passé à jamais révolu, du moins à l'échelle de plusieurs vies humaines, voire plus ? Ne faudrait-il pas remplacer "la normale" par "le passé" ? Le mot de "normal" porte toujours en lui-même l'idée que la situation pourrait redevenir ce qu'elle était avant. Malheureusement cela ne sera pas le cas.  Et l'évolution du climat à venir dépend avant tout de ce que feront les chinois, les américains, les indiens, et tout le reste du monde. Nous devons tout faire pour les inciter à baisser leurs émissions, et comme nous ne pouvons pas envoyer les chars et les avions chez tout le monde pour les obliger, la meilleure arme qu'il nous reste est de commencer à agir chez nous (de toute façon on va devoir le faire pour cause d'approvisionnement pétrolier et gazier déclinant) en donnant un exemple que d'autres voudront suivre. Le mimétisme est une réalité dans les sociétés humaines.  Mais il faut dans le même temps commencer à sérieusement se secouer sur ce qui s'appelle "l'adaptation" (et qui porte mal son nom puisque dans une partie des cas cela consistera hélas uniquement à encaisser la perte avec regrets), parce que même en commençant à agir demain matin la dérive climatique va s'amplifier à cause de l'inertie du système.   Au titre de "l'adaptation" aussi, il faut modifier les cultures et les pratiques agricoles, la forêt, repenser une partie des infrastructures, gérer l'eau différemment, déplacer préventivement des installations et bâtiments de bord de mer, modifier les bâtiments... Il y en a pour 2 générations et nous n'avons déjà que trop traîné. Peut-être que de supprimer partout le mot "normal" pour le remplacer par "passé révolu" nous aiderait à accélérer.

author: Jean-Marc Jancovici
content: Le pétrole devient hors de prix ? Remplaçons le ! Depuis des années déjà, le carburant disponible à la pompe incorpore des produits qui ne sont pas issus d'un gisement de pétrole, mais de cultures : - l'essence contient de l'éthanol issu de blé (oui oui de blé !), de betteraves, ou de maïs (aux USA 40% du maïs est utilisé pour faire des agrocarburants) - le diesel contient des huiles estérifiées issues du colza, du palme, du soja, voire du tournesol.   Cette idée de se passer de pétrole en utilisant des cultures illustre à merveille la difficulté de revenir à la situation énergétique "d'avant le pétrole" (donc avec juste des énergies renouvelables, au premier chef desquelles la biomasse) tout en conservant les acquis de la civilisation du pétrole, à savoir 1,2 milliard de voitures de plus d'une tonne sur terre, plus de 20.000 avions de ligne, sans compter les bateaux, tracteurs, engins de mine, poids lourds, et j'en passe.  Car des combustibles issus de la végétation, tout le monde en veut pour se passer d'or noir. Le secteur aérien compte très fort sur les "sustainable aviation fuels", largement dérivés de la biomasse, pendant que les gaziers comptent sur le "gaz vert", lui aussi issu de la biomasse (par fermentation), et que les constructeurs et utilisateurs de voitures comptent sur les "bio" (en fait agro) carburants.  Dans cette courte chronique diffusée Samedi dernier sur RTL, je propose un petit calcul d'ordre de grandeur pour expliquer pourquoi ces carburants resteront marginaux dans un monde consommant 4 milliards de tonnes de pétrole par an.   Par contre, plus nous voudrons mettre de dérivés de la biomasse dans nos moteurs, centrales électriques et chaudières, et moins il restera de surfaces disponibles pour nous nourrir, faire pousser des matériaux (bois, fibres, matières premières pour la chimie organique), et héberger la biodiversité.  Et, en cette période de prix très élevés pour les céréales, il faut rappeler que si nous avions accepté de diminuer la consommation des voitures de 20% (en les faisant plus petites et moins puissantes), nous n'aurions pas besoin donner une partie de nos cultures à manger à ces animaux à 4 roues, et la situation serait moins tendue pour ceux qui ont juste faim. Et plus le temps passera, et plus ce dilemme augmentera.

author: Jean-Marc Jancovici
content: Après le discours d'un jeune diplômé de Centrale Nantes qui avait déjà fait un peu de bruit (https://lnkd.in/eAyiq7At), c'est au tour d'un groupe de jeunes diplômés d'AgroParisTech de dire son malaise à l'idée de se mettre au service d'un projet dans lequel ils ne se reconnaissent pas.  Une fois ce constat posé arrive inévitablement la question suivante : que faire ? Et si le système doit être changé, faut-il entrer dans les organisations existantes pour les modifier de l'intérieur, ou "déserter", c'est à dire s'y opposer de l'extérieur ?  La bonne réponse emprunte probablement aux deux. En espérant que cela sera utile, voici quelques constats issus de ma modeste expérience :  - "de l'intérieur", un jeune fraîchement diplômé a un pouvoir plus que réduit pour "tout changer". Le pouvoir dans l'entreprise est exercé par des cadres qui ont déjà de l'expérience (au moins 10 ans et souvent 20 à 30). Et la crédibilité s'acquiert surtout par des expériences de gestion opérationnelle (patron(ne) d'une unité de production, responsable d'une marque, d'une zone, d'un centre de R&D, etc), et rarement par des expériences fonctionnelles comme la RSE, la seule exception étant celle de la personne en charge des finances... c'est à dire de l'indicateur conventionnel qui pose justement problème. Dit autrement, en entreprise on ne peut être crédible pour changer les choses de l'intérieur qu'une fois que l'on a contribué à perpétuer la situation à problème telle qu'elle est. Problème !  - par contre, dire que l'on ne veut pas aller dans une entreprise qui ne fait pas d'efforts, ou la quitter rapidement après y être entré pour cette raison, a de l'impact si ce mouvement se généralise. J'ai observé plusieurs fois des dirigeants d'entreprise impulser des "grandes manoeuvres" en constatant que leur entreprise perdait rapidement en attractivité auprès des jeunes. Le manifeste Pour un réveil écologique oeuvre en ce sens.  - la bonne combinaison de l'expérience et de l'action vient en général de personnes plus âgées - donc vues comme plus crédibles - qui ont compris de l'intérieur le fonctionnement, connaissent les codes, puis se sont mises "à l'extérieur" pour bousculer les acteurs. Cela donne des entités qui d'entrée de jeu se positionnent pour "changer les choses" (une tentative de recension existe là : https://shiftyourjob.org/ ).
